title: Full Stack Software Developer | Aircraft Weight & Balance Software Speci...
description:
**A unique career**
 Looking for a unique career that combines cutting-edge software development with the exciting world of aviation? Look no further! Our company is at the forefront of the industry, developing top-of-the-line software systems and applications for the aviation industry.
   

  

 As an employee of DynamicSource, you'll have the opportunity to work on projects that directly impact the safety and efficiency of the aviation industry. You'll collaborate with experts in the field to develop software that helps pilots, airlines, and aviation companies streamline their operations and maximize their efficiency.
   

  

 But what sets this career apart from others in the software development industry? For starters, you'll have the chance to work with cutting-edge technologies and platforms specifically designed for the aviation industry. You'll develop a deep understanding of the unique challenges and opportunities that come with developing software for one of the most safety-conscious industries out there, and you'll be at the forefront of developing new solutions to address these challenges.
   

  

 Additionally, you'll have the chance to work with a highly skilled and passionate team of professionals who share your commitment to excellence and innovation. You'll be surrounded by individuals who are passionate about aviation and software development, and who are constantly pushing the boundaries of what's possible.
   

  

 So if you're looking for a career that combines your love of technology with your passion for aviation, look no further. Join our team and be a part of a truly unique and exciting industry that is shaping the future of air travel.
   

  

 More information about DynamicSource is available at: https://www.dynamicsource.se/
   

  

**Your Job**
* Software system developer/project manager with a focus on Aircraft Weight & Balance Software
* Front- and backend system development in various software languages
* Designing, prototyping and implementing new features in an existing code base
* Organise and prioritize your tasks to meet deadlines
* Work with minimal supervision both remotely and in our Stockholm, Sweden office.
* Full lifecycle application development
* Software testing and quality assurance
* Support, maintain and document software functionality
* Flexibility to adapt and be responsive to customer driven change requirements
* Integrate software with existing systems
* Identify, evaluate and implement new technologies
* Continuous performance tuning, optimization and improvement of the existing code base


 You are a passionate and highly skilled software developer that will design, develop, test, support and install software solutions mainly for the aviation industry. You have experience in building secure, high-quality and innovative software in compliance with coding standards and technical design. We are ISO 27001 and ISO 9001 certified, and we maintain high standards for structured and methodical work.
   

  

**Skills**
**Must have** 
  

  

* JavaScript
+ Core
- Modern JavaScript/TypeScript, asynchronous programming (Promises, async/await)

+ Front-End
- React, Webpack


* PHP
+ Core: Fundamentals, OOP, error handling, PHP 7/8 features
+ Framework: Laminas, Symfony

* Databases
+ Relational (MySQL, MariaDB)

* DevOps and Deployment
+ Containerization (Docker)
+ Cloud services (AWS)

* API Development
+ RESTful APIs, JSON, GraphQL (optional but increasingly valuable)

* GIT
* Experience with test-driven development and current coding standards
* Excellent communication skills in English.
* Highly self-organised and disciplined / experience with remote work
* Project management skills


**Good to have**
* Swift / Objective-C
* Rust
* Experience with highly secure network communications.
* Experience with releasing apps on App Store
* Experience with planning releases and release cycles


**Bonus points**
* Neural networks, machine learning and implement AI routines
* Interest in aviation


**More**
 For this position, the Hybrid work model applies where you are expected to be at our office in Stockholm at least 2 days per week. The DynamicSource team is located in the greater Stockholm area.
   

  

 DynamicSource visit customers and participate in industry events (e.g. forums and product expos) and world wide travel may be required.

title: Backend Developer
description:
**Expleo** 
 is seeking a highly skilled and experienced
 **Back-end Developer** 
 to join our team in
 **Sweden** 
 (located in Gothenburg OR Stockholm).
   

  

 Our
 **ideal** 
 candidate has experience working with back-end micro-services on Kubernetes and loves to develop alongside a team of talented engineers.
   

  

 If you are a back-end engineer or a full-stack engineer looking to expand your skill set, we'd love to hear from you. Join our team today and take the next step in your career!
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Create the container infrastructure platform for the company
* Coordinate with other infrastructure teams to meet goals
* Enhance delivery systems with Continuous Integration
* Improve the monitoring and alert system
* Troubleshoot issues and solve problems where needed
* Create and nurture highly available systems on Kubernetes


**Qualifications**
* Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in computer science, information technology, or engineering
* At least 3+ years of experience working with Kubernetes
* Strong expertise in CI/CD implementation
* Thorough knowledge of Java, Spring Boot & Azure
* Understanding of micro-service design and architectural patterns
* Familiar with complex event processing and event-driven architecture


**Benefits**
**Who are we?**
 Expleo is a rapidly growing consulting company dedicated to delivering innovative solutions in the fields of AI engineering, digitalization, hyper-automation, cybersecurity, and data science. With a strong commitment to integrity, diversity, sustainability, and societal security, Expleo is at the forefront of creating a better future. Join our dynamic team and be part of our journey to shape the future of technology and business.
   

  

**What do we offer?**
* Collaborative working environment – we stand shoulder to shoulder with our clients and our peers through good times and challenges
* We empower all passionate technology loving professionals by allowing them to expand their skills and take part in inspiring projects
* Expleo Academy - enables you to acquire and develop the right skills by delivering a suite of accredited training courses
* Always working as one team, our people are not afraid to think big and challenge the status quo
* Collective agreement with the union
* Access to a collection of benefits and discounted prices on services and shops.
* Health benefits
* Expleo team activities


 "We are an equal opportunities employer and welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of their race, sex, disability, religion/belief, sexual orientation or age ”.

title: Backend Developer
description:
Valtech is looking for a Backend Developer based in Stockholm. Are you passionate about building innovative, scalable solutions
 *,* 
 do you have an eye for detail, and do you thrive in collaborative working environment? Are you based in Stockholm and able to work on-site with our clients in the area on a regular basis? Then you might be the person we’re looking for! Keep reading to find out.
   

  

 We are looking for multiple profiles, both fluent in Swedish, and non-Swedish speaking.
   

  

 A day in the life of a Backend Developer
   

  

 Your role as a Backend Developer and a consultant at Valtech will not only entail providing technical expertise but also understanding the business needs of our clients and effectively communicating how our solutions can address their challenges and contribute to their success.
   

  

 Your responsibilities will encompass every stage of client engagements, from initial discovery to final delivery. This will involve close collaboration with local and regional project teams, both internally at Valtech and alongside our valued clients.
   

  

**In Addition, You Will**
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design, develop, and mantain innovative solutions that meet client requirements
* Contribute to the continuous improvement of our development processes and methodologies
* Work with modern development practices, including CI/CD, containerization (Docker, Kubernetes), and automated testing
* Help maintain system documentation and participate in project reviews
* Actively participate in client meetings, workshops, and presentations to ensure alignment and transparency throughout the project lifecycle


 You and the role
   

  

 You are a developer at mid-to-senior level with at least 5 years of experience in the field of backend-end development. As a person, you are flexible and adaptable to changes, and can see yourself thriving in working in a highly innovative fast-paced start-up like environment.
   

  

 We would love if you have
   

  

* A relevant technical education or equivalent level of experience within the following areas or similar: computer science, software engineering, application development, backend engineering
* At least 5 years of professional experience in backend development, ideally in an agile project environment
* Preferable professional working experience from IT consultancy, digital agency, start-up or similar fast-paced working environment
* Proven track record of effectively engaging with stakeholders and identifying opportunities to add value to their projects
* Flexibility to work on-site in and around Stockholm multiple times a week


**Your Technical Skills Should Include**
* Solid knowledge of both Java and .NET
* Experience working with cloud solutions (Azure, AWS, GCP)
* Ideally, you are comfortable working with containerized solutions (Kubernetes, Docker)
* Any experience or interest to work with Kotlin will be considered as a plus but is not required for this role
* Experience working in agile working environment with tools like Jira and Confluence


 What you can expect from us
   

  

 Valtech will always be recognized not just for the quality of the work we deliver, but for all the amazing people that make it happen. We don’t just talk about how to get things done; we really do transform by doing. We have an inclusive culture where we share our thoughts and our knowledge, we have fun together, and we care about each other. Our core values, Share, Care, Dare defines our culture and makes Valtech a workplace where you thrive and develop. Read more about life at Valtech here.
   

  

 You can read more about our benefits and what we offer here.
   

  

  

  

 Join Valtech
   

  

 Not only can you help us lead the experience revolution, but you can lead the change. The journey Valtech is on is ambitious and therefore opens doors. The more we grow – the more opportunities there are to take responsibility, implement your creative ideas, and be the innovator and driver to help move us, and our clients, forward.
   

  

**Does it excite you to join Valtech on this journey? And would you like to become our next Backend Developer?**
**Then apply today** 
 . We cannot wait to hear from you!

title: Senior Software Development Engineer
company_industry: Hospitals and Health Care, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Software Development
description:
**What You’ll Do At Elekta**
 At Elekta, we don’t just build technology. We build hope for everyone dealing with cancer. As Senior Software Development Engineer, you will be designing and implementing the user workflows for our radiation therapy products and contribute to the innovation of tomorrow’s radiotherapy solutions.
   

  

 Your team is part of an international program that consists of a diverse group of specialists in mechanical engineering, electronics, physics, embedded software, and more.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
 As a Senior Software Development Engineer, you’ll be an essential part of our dynamic, cross-functional team, contributing to every stage of the development lifecycle—from gathering requirements to design, implementation, testing, and documentation. You'll have the opportunity to:
   

  

* Collaborate and Innovate: Work alongside talented engineers and stakeholders to build cutting-edge software solutions, influencing both front-end and back-end development.
* Drive Technological Advancement: Evaluate and implement the latest technologies, methodologies, and products to ensure we're always at the forefront of the industry.
* Continuous Growth: Stay ahead of the curve by following the latest technical and clinical advancements in the field, ensuring you’re always learning and evolving as a professional.


 Join us to make a significant impact in a fast-paced, innovative environment where your expertise is valued and your ideas have a real influence on the direction of our products!
   

  

**What You Bring**
 We are looking for a creative and smart new colleague, who works best in teams. You have a can-do attitude and a problem-solving mindset. The team works with software solutions that guide the users through the radiotherapy treatment workflow. They are enthusiastic about writing efficient code with great user experience - we think you are too. In addition, we believe you have :
   

  

* a Bachelor's or Master's degree in computer science, physics, electronics or similar
* worked with frontend development using Angular and Typescript.
* worked with backend development in C# .NET.


 It is meriting if you have
   

  

* Experience of working in MedTech or some other regulated industry .
* Exposure to working with Docker / Kubernetes.


**Why should you join Elekta?**
 In this role, you will work for a higher purpose; hope for everyone dealing with cancer, and for everyone regardless of where in the world, to have access to the best cancer care. In addition to this, our benefit package includes:
   

  

* 30 paid vacation days/year, additional 4 Elekta days off /year (plus bank holidays).
* Attractive defined contribution pension scheme.
* Private Medical Insurance.
* Lunch Benefit.
* Contribution to wellness activities.
* Hybrid work option (you are required to work on location at least 3 days/week).


**Hiring Process**
 We are looking forward to hearing from you! Apply by submitting your application and resumé in English, via the “Apply” button. Please note that we do not accept applications by e-mail.
   

  

 For questions, please contact the responsible Global TA Partner Nidhi Sarkar at nidhi.sarkar@elekta.com.
   

  

**We are an equal opportunity employer**
 We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other status protected by law in the locations where Elekta operates.

title: Tech lead - .net
description:
**This is Everone**
 Vi är en agentur för duktiga och ambitiösa systemutvecklare. Våra utvecklare arbetar i backend, fullstack, frontend och med design. Med moderna plattformar och ny teknik bygger våra utvecklare digitala lösningar och innovationer för framtiden hos våra kunder.
   

  

 Vi förstår att du är grym på att koda, därför är det exakt vad du ska lägga din dyrbara tid på. Medan vi ansvarar för att förhandla ditt timpris och dina förmåner, sköta administrationen och hjälpa dig utvecklas i karriären.
   

  

**Om uppdraget**
 Vi söker nu en
 **Tech Lead/Lead Developer** 
 för ett spännande uppdrag där du kommer att ansvara för att bygga upp och driva ett utvecklingsteam samt delta i utvecklingsarbetet för att skapa effektiva lösningar.
   

  

 Du kommer att utveckla webbapplikationer samt de mikrotjänster som tillsammans med andra system bildar den nya trafikhanteringsförmågan inom färdtjänsten.
   

  

 Eftersom teamet är nytt, kommer du ha en central roll i att etablera teamets kultur, arbetssätt och tekniska riktning.
   

  

**Dina Arbetsuppgifter Inkluderar**
* Bidra med teknisk expertis genom att vara delaktig i utvecklingsarbetet.
* Driva och delta i utvecklingsarbete från kravinsamling till färdig produkt.
* Coacha och stödja utvecklare för att maximera teamets prestation.
* Designa och implementera tekniska lösningar i linje med initiativets mål.
* Hantera tekniska utmaningar och lösa komplexa problem.
* Utföra kodgranskningar och säkerställa att utvecklingen följer best practices.
* Samarbeta med olika intressenter för att översätta affärskrav till tekniska lösningar.
* Vara teknisk expert och rådgivare för ledningen och andra intressenter.


**Vem är du?**
 För att trivas i rollen ser vi att du är en samarbetsorienterad och kommunikativ ledare som har en god förståelse för systemutveckling och teamledning. Du gillar att arbeta i komplexa miljöer och är van vid att förstå affärsbehov och omvandla dem till tekniska lösningar.
   

  

**Krav För Rollen**
* Minst 6 års arbetslivserfarenhet av systemutveckling i C# de senaste 12 åren.
* Arbetslivserfarenhet av att utveckla mikrotjänster genom eventdriven design i minst 2 uppdrag de senaste 5 åren.
* Arbetslivserfarenhet i rollen som mjukvaruarkitekt (eller motsvarande) i minst 1 uppdrag de senaste 4 åren.
* Arbetslivserfarenhet av Kubernetes i minst 3 år de senaste 6 åren.
* Arbetslivserfarenhet av DevOps i minst 3 år de senaste 6 åren.
* Arbetslivserfarenhet av design och utveckling av databaser (SQL/No-SQL) i minst 6 år.
* Arbetslivserfarenhet av att arbeta som lead developer i minst 2 uppdrag de senaste 6 åren.


**Mervärdeskrav**
* Arbetslivserfarenhet av DevOps-verktygen Terraform eller Helm Charts i minst 2 uppdrag
* Arbetslivserfarenhet av arbete med Kubernetes Rancher i minst 1 år
* Arbetslivserfarenhet av att arbeta med infrastruktur (nät, routing, DNS) i en Linuxmiljö i minst 1 år
* Arbetslivserfarenhet av att arbeta med BDD (Behaviour-driven development) i minst 1 år
* Arbetslivserfarenhet av verktyg som Apache Kafka eller RabbitMQ i minst 1 uppdrag


**Placering och omfattning**
* På kontor i Stockholm, med viss möjlighet till distansarbete
* Uppdraget har en omfattning på 100 % (40 timmar per vecka) och är en konsultanställning via Everone.


 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan! 🚀

title: C++ Developer
description:
We believe that you are dreaming of using your skills in C++ and your innovative mindset to create a better democratic world. Especially by solving crimes, gathering intelligence, investigating fraud and fighting corruption. At MSAB we make that dream come true!
 



  





 MSAB is one of the world’s leading digital forensic companies. We develop digital forensic solutions for mobile device examination and analysis used globally. Working with programming you will perform demanding tasks that tickles your innovative mindset and challenge your technical skills to find your way forward towards a solution.
 



  





 If you are inspired by extracting and decrypting data, writing decoders and implementations, decoding apps, analyzing data structure and making them readable. Then you are interesting to us.
 



 If you also are capable in writing efficient code, embedded programming, have knowledge in Android and iOS operating systems and have skills in reverse engineering or perhaps cryptology. Then we want to know more about you.
 



  





 This is a chance to work in a company culture described as friendly, we listen to new ideas and help each other. You will have freedom to find your way forward and benefit from your innovative thinking. If this is a match and you also are inspired by being pushed beyond your comfort zone. Then we want to talk with you.
 



  





 There is so much to talk about like values, plans forward, benefits, ways of working and technology for example. But we save that for the interview.
 



  





 Send your application now!
 



  





 For more information about the role, you are welcome to contact torgny.sodrin@msab.com.
 



 For more information about MSAB: https://www.msab.com/
 



 MSAB is a world leader in forensic technology for extracting and analyzing data from mobile devices. The MSAB vision is to empower every investigation with digital forensic solutions for a safer world.
 



  





 MSAB deliver high quality digital forensic solutions to extract, review, analyze and manage data and are a trusted partner to Law Enforcement, Defense Forces, Government Agencies and Forensic Laboratories in democratic countries throughout the world enabling them to investigate crime, gather intelligence, investigate fraud and fight corruption. Our values encompass being an ethics-driven company focused on innovation and results.

title: Senior Back end Developer
description:
Vill du vara kollega med riktigt grymma och erfarna utvecklare som älskar att hålla koll på den senaste tekniken? Tycker du dessutom att sammanhållning är viktigt och att det är kul att dela med dig av dina kunskaper?
   

  

 Du kommer ha runt 25 härliga och drivna kollegor i vårt lilla bolag och ca 1000 medarbetare till om du så önskar inom B3 koncernen. På B3 CodeRight har vi en genomsnittlig arbetslivserfarenhet på över 15 år.
   

  

**Vem vi söker:**
 Du brinner för att designa och implementera robusta och skalbara backend-lösningar. Du håller dig uppdaterad på det senaste. Du är proaktiv, lyhörd och pragmatisk. Vi tycker att det är viktigt att använda rätt teknik/lösning för situationen. Om motiverat, gärna den senaste tekniken.
   

  

**Krav:**
* Tekniska färdigheter: Minst 10 års erfarenhet av backendutveckling på Microsoft stacken (C#, .NET, Azure)
* Meriterande: Microservices, Containerteknologier, CI/CD, om du vid behov även kan ta rollen som lösningsarkitekt och/eller frontendutvecklare.
* Språkkunskaper: Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska (tal och skrift)


**Vad väntar du på?** 
 Skicka din ansökan nu!
   

  

 Vill du veta mer? Tveka inte att höra av dig till VD Christian Bratt - Tel: 0702 75 48 40 /
 **christian.bratt@b3.se**
 Tyvärr kan vi ej ta emot e-postansökningar p.g.a. GDPR.
   

  

**Placering:** 
 Stockholm eller pendlingsavstånd.

title: Software Engineer - R&D
description:
Vill du jobba med produktnära utveckling inom industrin?
   

  

 HiQ samarbetar idag med teknikintensiva kunder i framkant som produktbolag inom industrin, försvar och autonoma fordon. Det kan handla om förarlösa tåg eller elektrifierade tunga lastbilar samt sensor och navigationssystem för både båtar och flyg. Vi är involverade i utvecklingen av både komponenterna i fordonen och de som finns vid sidan av dem. En del av projekten har en internationell omfattning med hög säkerhetsklassning.
   

  

 Vi söker dig som gillar att grotta ner dig i komplexa problem. Vi tror att det är bäst för helheten i projektet om du är trygg i din kompetens och har några års erfarenhet med dig in i rollen.
   

  

**Till dessa projekt är vi i behov av personer med kompetens inom:**
* Mjukvaruutveckling inom C++ eller Java
* Testautomatisering
* DevOps
* Arkitekt med kunskap inom inbyggda system


**Vi ser gärna att du utöver ovanstående också har:**
* Universitetsutbildning inom relevant område
* Erfarenhet eller starkt intresse för industribranschen
* Förståelse och möjlighet att göra dig förstådd på svenska
* Svenskt medborgarskap


**Om HiQ**
 HiQ är ett kulturdrivet företag med över 2000 medarbetare i fyra länder. Här hittar du specialister inom allt från utveckling, test och cybersäkerhet till projektledning, design och agil coachning. Vi har en gemensam ambition: att förenkla och förbättra människors liv med hjälp av teknik och kommunikation – samtidigt som vi har roligt på vägen. Hos oss är du välkommen precis som du är, och vårt öppna arbetsklimat uppmuntrar till kreativitet, samarbete och personlig utveckling.
   

  

 Vi ser framemot din ansökan!

title: Lead Developer E-commerce & Performance Marketing
description:
**Om oss** 




  





 Hailey’s Jewelry House och Diamantbrev är en del av en snabbväxande koncern inom guld- och diamantbranschen. Diamantbrev köper in guld och diamanter från privatpersoner över hela Sverige, medan Hailey’s Jewelry House säljer restaurerade smycken i nyskick – med fokus på kvalitet, hållbarhet och återbruk. Under de kommande åren planerar båda bolagen att expandera till flera nya marknader.
 



  




**Rollen**

  





 Vill du vara med och förändra en hel bransch? Vi söker en tekniskt vass och strategiskt skarp person som kommer att spela stor roll i vår digitala tillväxtresa – från val av plattform till SEO, SEM, CRO och internationell expansion. En roll med mycket hands-on.
 



  





 Du kommer att vara arkitekten bakom den digitala infrastrukturen för Hailey’s Jewelry House och Diamantbrev – två snabbväxande bolag med globala ambitioner. Tillsammans med vår VD kommer du att forma hur vi bygger, växer och syns digitalt.
 



  




**Om rollen**

  




* Du ansvarar för valet av framtoda teknikstack (WordPress, headless, Shopify Plus)



  




* Du leder utvecklingen av våra sajter – snabbhet, skalbarhet och konvertering är nyckelord.



  




* Du ansvarar över vår digitala synlighet – SEO, Google Ads, Meta Ads, retargeting.



  




* Du optimerar kundresan – ständiga förbättringar genom A/B-testning, data och analys.



  




* Du anpassar våra plattformar för nya marknader – språk, API:er, valutor och betalningslösningar.



  





  





  





**Vem vi söker** 




  




* Du har teknisk erfarenhet av att bygga och skala e-handel – gärna i WordPress, Shopify eller headless-miljöer.



  




* Du kan koda (HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP eller liknande).



  




* Du har djup kunskap inom SEO och SEM – och förstår vad som krävs för att ranka och synas på den svenska såväl som internationella marknaden.



  




* Du jobbar datadrivet och älskar att förbättra.



  




* Du trivs i högt tempo, får saker gjorda och vill bygga något stort – snabbt.



  





  





  





**Vi erbjuder** 




  




* Möjligheten att vara med på resan att förändra hela smyckesbranschen.



  




* En central roll i ett snabbväxande bolag med tydliga tillväxtmål.



  




* Frihet, ansvar och stor påverkan – din kompetens kommer göra skillnad.



  





  





  





 Urval sker löpande. Skicka därför in din ansökan så snart som möjligt.

title: Backend Engineer - Consumer Experience team
description:
**About Us**
 In 2022, Instabee was founded after combining Budbee and Instabox - two leading last-mile delivery companies with three consumer-facing brands: Budbee, Instabox, and Porterbuddy. Instabee serves millions of consumers across Europe with convenient deliveries and is on track to become the leading European e-commerce enabler. Always with the consumer at heart.
   

  

 We’re fast, both in terms of parcel delivery and when it comes to growing our business. So far our journey has taken us from Sweden to the rest of Scandinavia and parts of continental Europe, but we have no plans on stopping anytime soon. As we continue to expand, the complexity of Instabee grows in parallel. With that in mind, we’re now looking for you to help us on the journey ahead.
   

  

**About The Role**
 We’re looking for a
 **Senior Backend Developer** 
 to join our mission of creating seamless delivery experiences for our consumers across all consumer facing products. You'll be developing and maintaining some of Sweden's most widely used delivery tracking services, using modern tools and technologies to create exceptional user experiences.
   

  

**Your future team**
 The Consumer Experience team is responsible for creating a seamless delivery experience for our consumers across all consumer facing products. We want to do everything we can to understand our consumers and adapt to new market trends. By increasing transparency and improving flexibility during the delivery journey - we aim to create the world’s best delivery tracking platforms.
   

  

**What We're Looking For**
 We are looking for a senior engineer with at least 7+ years of work experience - If you are a skilled problem solver who loves coding and making complex things work, then this is the place for you! We value individuals who are keen to learn, and your eagerness to develop your skill set will probably be your strongest asset when joining us. Beyond that we imagine that you have the following:
   

  

* At least 7 years of work experience as a Backend Engineer in a modern tech environment
* Experience with Java, do you also know Node.js it’s a bonus
* PostgreSQLr experience
* Understanding of Terraform and/or devops
* Great problem-solving skills and ability to think about sustainable and long-term solutions
* Experience in working with an agile development methodology
* Comfortable making both technical and business decisions
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English
* Based in Sweden (Stockholm)
* Experience in owning a solution from the initial idea all the way to rolling it out.
* Experience in leading a team in solving technical issues.


 If this is you then we can’t wait to meet you!
   

  

**What You’ll Get**
 We can promise you that you will be challenged, develop your skills and have the opportunity to work with truly amazing and competent colleagues. If you like changes and want to set new processes and ways of working - this is the place for you!
   

  

**Benefits**
 Of course, we have all the necessary and standard benefits in place, but in addition to this, we can also offer:
   

  

 🌇 Sky-High Office: Modern and newly renovated with a 360-degree view around Stockholm.
   

  

 🐶 Puppy Friendly: Bring your dog to work - we've got a whole floor for our furry friends!
   

  

 🍸 Rooftop Fridays: Chill out at our Friday rooftop bar with the best views in town
   

  

 🥐 Wednesdays Tech Breakfasts: Fuel your midweek with tech talks and tasty bites.
   

  

 👾 Tech Demos: Dive into the latest innovations with our regular tech showcases.
   

  

 💻 Modern Tech Stack: Work with cutting-edge technology every day.
   

  

 🏓 Fun & Games: Ping pong, Shuffleboard, Foosball, and even a Karaoke Room for your leisure time.
   

  

 ⏰ Flexible Hours: Hybrid setup with working hours that adapt to your lifestyle.
   

  

 👶 Parental Pay for Six Months: Step away from work and provide the best care
   

  

 and love to your little one.
   

  

 🎂 A Day Off on Your Birthday: We love to celebrate, so enjoy your birthday to the fullest with a day off each year!
   

  

 Diversity and inclusion is very important to us and we are committed to creating an inclusive work environment. We want to be a workplace where everyone’s perspectives and opinions are valued, and we are dedicated to creating opportunities for all employees to thrive and reach their full potential.
   

  

*This recruitment process consists of background checks via Verifiera as a review of previous public criminal records. The result is public information that is handled confidentially. This is mandatory for all recruitment processes at Instabee (Instabox/Budbee) in Sweden.*
 Instabee was founded in 2022 after combining Budbee and Instabox — two leading last-mile delivery companies with three consumer-facing brands: Budbee, Instabox and Porterbuddy. Instabee is present in six countries, serving thousands of online merchants, including ASOS, Zalando, Inditex and H&M and is on track to become the most admired European e-commerce enabler.
   

  

 Since the start, Instabee has focused on consumer-centric and sustainable solutions, offering deliveries to boxes and homes using muscle power, electricity, renewable diesel and biofuels. Through bespoke technical solutions, Instabee can guarantee optimal fill rates and routing, minimising any unnecessary transports. Instabee is backed by Kinnevik, Creades and EQT, among others.

title: Pega Developer
description:
Choosing Capgemini means choosing a company where you will be empowered to shape your career in the way you’d like, where you’ll be supported and inspired by a collaborative community of colleagues around the world, and where you’ll be able to reimagine what’s possible. Join us and help the world’s leading organizations unlock the value of technology and build a more sustainable, more inclusive world.
   

  

**YOUR ROLE**
 Join our dynamic Pega development team in Stockholm, the largest in the Nordics, where you'll collaborate with over 40 talented colleagues to deliver innovative solutions for our clients. As a key player in our team, you'll:
   

  

* Lead the Way: Provide expert advice from the early stages of projects through to the implementation and integration of the Pega platform, ensuring the right architecture and solutions are in place.
* Solve Complex Challenges: Leverage our global experience and expertise to tackle our clients' toughest problems, enabling them to swiftly adapt to new business needs and opportunities.
* Embrace Cutting-Edge Technology: Work with the latest trends in Business Process Management (BPM), primarily within Pega, and stay at the forefront of technological advancements.
* Thrive in a Collaborative Environment: Be part of a global organization that values client focus, teamwork, and continuous learning, offering you endless opportunities for growth and development.


**YOUR PROFILE**
* Experience in BPM / CRM development.
* A great drive to develop and adopt new technology.
* Good knowledge of Swedish and English.
* Certified CSSA or CLSA.


**What We Believe You Will Enjoy About Working Here.**
* We recognize the significance of flexible work arrangements to provide support. Be it remote work, or flexible work hours, you will get an environment to maintain healthy work life balance.
* All employees are covered by a collective agreement and receive occupational pension, insurance, parental benefits and health care allowance – among other best-in-class benefits.
* A company culture driven by core values: Honesty, Trust, Freedom, Team Spirit, Modesty, Fun, and Boldnes
* Exciting career opportunities locally and internationally, and fantastic networks of expertise. With over 4000 colleagues in Sweden only, you are part of a sharp, technology and business focused community, where Coursera and more than 250 000 (!) courses and certifications are offered to all employees.

 Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. title: Supply Chain Developer
description:
Är du en stjärna inom logistik och gillar analytisk problemlösning? Vill du arbeta i en projektledande roll och vara med att utveckla och förbättra processer? Tycker du att logistik och att utveckla processer typ är det roligaste som finns? Då skulle den här rollen kunna vara något för dig!
   

  

 Supply Chain inom Apohem ansvarar för alla processer & system kopplat till lager och transporter. Verksamheten växer och utvecklas i rekordfart och vi jobbar kontinuerligt med projekt inom processförbättringar, kapacitet, automation och digitalisering. Just nu bygger vi en ny toppmodern lageranläggning och vi behöver förstärka teamet inom Supply Chain Development för att kunna leda och driva de förändringar vi har framför oss.
   

  

**Om Rollen**
 Som Supply Chain Developer kommer du bland annat leda, utveckla och implementera förbättringsprojekt inom det vi kallar Supply Chain, vilket omfattar processer inom lager, transport och inköp. Du arbetar med analyser med syfte att utvärdera och effektivisera processer och hjälper till att ta fram och implementera förbättringsförslag. Du har också ett ansvar för och kommer leda & driva utveckling och förbättringar inom våra frakttjänster i vår fraktväljare i kassan. Du rapporterar till Head of Supply Chain Development, men kommer även jobba tätt kring transportfrågor med vår Chief Supply Chain Officer.
   

  

**Du kommer göra det här (och säkert mer):**
* Leda och implementera projekt och förbättringsaktiviteter inom Supply Chain
* Analysera och utvärdera krav från verksamheten, kopplat till förbättringar och förändringar inom processer, system och automation.
* Kravställa, utveckla, testa och driftsätta förändringar i system och verktyg
* Implementera processer, arbetssätt och rutiner i verksamheten
* Kontinuerligt optimera och implementera leveranssätt i kassan utifrån kostnad, kvalitet och kundnöjdhet


**Vi Tror Att Du**
* Har minst 3 års erfarenhet av projektledning inom logistik (gärna inom ehandel)
* Har relevant akademisk utbildning inom logistik och/eller projektledning
* Har mycket goda kunskaper i Excel
* Gärna har erfarenhet från IT-utveckling kopplat till logistik, t ex WMS-system, transportadministrativa system
* Är van vid att leda och driva projekt och aktiviteter från start till mål


**Vi Vill Också Att Du**
* Är resultatdriven och lösningsorienterad
* Är analytisk med förmåga att fatta egna beslut
* Är tydlig, kommunikativ och bra på att bygga relationer med olika kontaktytor
* Är engagerad och ansvarstagande med känsla för såväl helhet som detaljer
* Är initiativtagande och ser möjligheter snarare än problem.
* Har erfarenhet och intresse av logistik, e-handel och automation
* Är prestigelös och inte rädd för att kavla upp ärmarna
* Har goda kunskaper i svenska, både i tal och skrift


**Låter det spännande?**
 Sök jobbet! Klicka omedelbums på knappen "Jag vill söka jobbet", gör din grej och så hör vi av oss så fort vi gått igenom din ansökan.
   

  

 Apohem är en utmanare i apoteksbranschen som vill göra apotek, hälsa och skönhet tillgängligt för alla. Det ska inte vara dyrt eller krångligt att ta hand om sig själv och dem man tycker om. Därför erbjuder vi över 20 000 handplockade produkter, tillsammans med inspiration, vägledning och personlig rådgivning från farmaceuter, hudterapeuter och kundrådgivare.
   

  

 Apohem ingår i Axel Johnson-koncernen och är sedan 2019 ett fullskaligt apotek. Apohem är för tredje året i rad en av Sveriges snabbast växande e-handlare och Sveriges snabbast växande apotek.

title: Software Engineer - Python - Container Images
description:
Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1100+ colleagues in 75+ countries and very few office based roles. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution. The company is founder led, profitable and growing.
   

  

 Canonical is building a new generation of Ubuntu-based container images to simplify open-source application deployment across the world. These container images will be free to use with long-term security commitments, and engineered for performance, security and usability. As with Ubuntu, we will work in the open and welcome community participation.
   

  

 In this role, you'll be building and maintaining an ever-growing portfolio of container images while working with multiple teams, both inside and outside Canonical, to ensure these are of the highest quality and offer a seamless Ubuntu user experience. You will also be highly involved in the implementation and maintenance of the Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery automation around these container images, for which you are expected to demonstrate deep insights into container-based DevOps.
   

  

 You will be contributing to fast-moving products like Rocks (OCI images) and thus have the chance to help steer and consolidate this growing team. You'll gain experience with numerous container technologies and open source projects, where your feedback and contributions will be critical to driving widespread container adoption. As an engineer, your seniority will be based on your software development background and ability to lead junior team members.
   

  

 Come build a rewarding, meaningful career working with the best and brightest people in technology at Canonical. This is an exciting opportunity for experienced software engineers looking for a place to leave their mark, who are passionate about shaping an open source product with the highest quality, with and for the community!
   

  

* Location\*\*: EMEA


**This role entails**
* Build robust, scalable, leading-edge container images
* Work on automated CI/CD processes for building, testing and publishing our container images
* Write tools and tests for assessing security compliance and cloud-native compatibility
* Participate in strong engineering process through code and architectural review
* Contribute, both as a user and developer, to the improvement of our Python- and Go-based container-building tools
* Provide technical feedback for the team's decision-making process
* Engage with the open-source community as a subject-matter expert
* Grow our knowledge base and write documentation
* Work in a collaborative, agile and globally distributed environment
* Mentor and help hiring
* Work from home with global travel up to 15% for internal and external events


**What we are looking for in you**
* You are knowledgeable and passionate about software development
* You are a team player and have experience in collaborative development
* You have worked with CI/CD systems (e.g. Jenkins, GitHub Actions, Concourse CI, etc.)
* You are familiar with GitOps principles and workflows
* You have a track record of delivering timely, high-quality software
* You have experience building container images
* You master at least one container management/orchestration tool (e.g. Docker, Kubernetes, etc.)
* You have experience with Python
* You are experienced with Linux systems administration and package management
* You have strong written and verbal communication skills to convey technical concepts
* You bring clarity to technical and engineering discussions
* You are someone who strongly believes that sharing is caring, and knowledge is power
* Your skills range from those of a Graduate to a mid-senior Software Engineer
* You have a Bachelor's or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM or a similar degree


**What we offer you**
 We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
   

  

* Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
* Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Maternity and paternity leave
* Employee Assistance Programme
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
* Priority Pass, and travel upgrades for long haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.
   

  

**Canonical is an equal opportunity employer**
 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: Microsoft Dynamics 365 - Developer
description:
Om tjänsten
   

  

 We are currently looking to strengthen our organization with developers who have deep knowledge of the Dynamics platform and experience with integration technologies in the Azure platform to work on a customer management and trading platform.
   

  

 With your team, you directly contribute to Vattenfall’s vision to become fossil-free within one generation and enable customers to make that choice.
   

  

 You will become part of Customer IT. Customer IT develops and operates specialized IT solutions closely together with business colleagues to create value for our customers. Customer IT is set up locally, in Sweden, Germany, Netherlands, and Poland. Customer IT Nordics is divided into four teams located in Sweden. In this role as a Microsoft Dynamics 365 CE (Online) developer, you must be self-motivated, proactive, and analytical. You feel personally committed to achieving the team's goals and success.
   

  

 Finally, you are a person who wants to develop colleagues by proactively coaching and supporting them.
   

  

**Your Tasks And Responsibilities**
 You will provide expertise in the areas of implementation of an ongoing project, governance, and technical support to ensure software solutions are designed, developed, and implemented in Dynamics and Azure to meet business needs. You will assist in planning, designing, and customizing new Dynamics solutions. You will also work with continuous improvements of the delivered services.
   

  

**Key Objectives in the role**
* Dynamics 365 CE Solution Design
* Dynamics 365 CE Plug-in Development
* Integrations and technologies built in Azure


 Din bakgrund
   

  

* At least 3-5 years of related experience in developing and maintaining Dynamics 365 CE applications.
* You have experience of working in Azure
* Fluent in English in writing and verbally
* Preferable fluent in Swedish in writing and verbally
* You worked in an agile environment and practiced agile software development


 Mer information
   

  

**Our Offer**
 We offer a challenging and international work environment and the possibility to work with some of the best in the field. You will be working in interdisciplinary teams and you can always count on support from committed colleagues as ‘Ask and Share’ concept is essential for the way we work. We offer attractive employment conditions (smart working, flexible working hours and a good-work-life balance) and opportunities for personal and professional development. Click here for further information.
   

  

**Location**
 Solna
   

  

**For more information,** 
 you are welcome to contact the hiring manager Vidhu Agarwal vidhu.agarwal@vattenfall, com. For more information about the recruitment process, you are welcome to contact our recruiter Carolina Osterman carolina.osterman@vattenfall.com
   

  

 Trade Union representatives are Akademikerna – Sofi Wadström and Silvija Vatkovic, Ledarna – Christer Gustafsson, SEKO – Juha Siipilehto, Unionen – Inger Strandberg. You can reach them on 08-739 50 00.
   

  

**We welcome your application in English no later than 23rd of March 2025.** 
 We kindly request that you do not send applications by any means other than via our website.
   

  

 At Vattenfall we are convinced that diversity contributes to build a more profitable and attractive company and we strive to be a good role model regarding diversity. Vattenfall works actively for all employees to have the same opportunities and rights regardless of gender, ethnicity, age, transgender identity or expression, religion or other belief, disability or sexual orientation. Click here for further information.
   

  

 The security of Vattenfall and its employees is essential. For that reason, a pre-employment screening will be part of your recruitment process. The screening is based on the role you will fulfill within Vattenfall.
   

  

 Since Vattenfall is a part of the Swedish critical infrastructure, many of our services are security classed. If this position is security classed the final candidates might be subjected to a security vetting process, according to the Swedish legislation.
   

  

 We look forward to receiving your application!
   

  

 Om oss
   

  

 Vattenfall is one of Europe’s largest producers and retailers of electricity and heat. Our main markets are Sweden, Germany, the Netherlands, Denmark, and the UK. The Vattenfall Group has approximately 21 000 employees. We have been electrifying industries, powering homes and transforming life through innovation for more than 100 years. We now want to make fossil free living possible within one generation and we are driving the transition to a sustainable energy system. To be able to reach this ambitious goal we are looking for talented individuals who, in addition to their passion for their role, also have strong team spirit and want to contribute to supporting a meaningful corporate mission.
