 Welcome packs & occasional gifts

title: Integration Specialist – Stockholm
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting and Design Services
description:
Befinner du dig i ett flow när du får jobba med systemintegration och moderna API-centriska lösningar? Kanske trivs du ännu mer då du får jobba med trevliga teammedlemmar och ha kul tillsammans i utmanande uppdrag? Vi vill nu bli fler i vårt Connectivity-team i Sverige – kanske är du vår nästa kollega?
   

  

 På Solita har vi över 20 års erfarenhet av integration och processautomation – och vår passion för att hjälpa kunder att skapa robusta, skalbara och framtidssäkra lösningar är lika stark idag som när vi började. Våra integrationsspecialister arbetar nära våra kunder för att förstå deras unika behov. Genom att använda den senaste tekniken inom API-design, molnintegration och DevOps säkerställer vi inte bara snabb leverans av affärsvärde, utan också effektiva kopplingar mellan system och dataflöden.
   

  

 En dag på Solita
   

  

 En dag på Solita kan ofta börja med ett standup-möte med kund och dina team-medlemmar, där ni planerar dagens arbete, går igenom prioriteringar och identifierar eventuella utmaningar. Sen kliver du in i ditt arbete: kanske jobbar du med att utveckla integrationer och API:er i exempelvis Azure, migrera integrationer mellan olika plattformar, eller fokuserar på att skissa upp en integrationslösning baserat på en kravspec. Under dagen kan det dyka upp ad-hoc möten med kund eller kollegor som behöver stöttning i sitt arbete. Ofta innebär det att lösa problem: kanske behöver du felsöka en oväntad driftstörning, identifiera en flaskhals i ett integrationsflöde eller hitta en ny väg för att möta kundens krav.
   

  

 Du kan också delta i våra interna utbildningsmöten, så kallade infosessions, där vi delar kunskap om allt från nya teknologier till banbrytande arbetssätt. Dagen fortsätter med utveckling och kanske ett par korta avstämningar och inte minst – fika!
   

  

**Emma Fägerlind** 
 som jobbar som Integration Lead hos oss, beskriver sitt nuvarande uppdrag:
   

  

*“Mitt team bygger integrationer som ska stödja HR- och ekonomiprocesser för en kommun. Som integrationsledare har jag en blandad roll där jag både får arbeta med samordning, funktionskrav och teknisk lösning. Jag hjälper att ta fram specifikationer och förstå vad det är vi behöver göra för att lösa kundens behov. När är vi stöter på problem eller frågor försöker få jag teamet att komma framåt genom att lyfta frågor till relevanta parter.*
*Problemlösningen är det roligaste i mitt jobb – att få sätta sig in i nya flöden och tekniker och tillsammans med andra försöka hitta den lämpligaste lösningen. Det är fantastiskt att få vara del av ett team och se hur olika personers egenskaper bidrar på olika sätt till resultatet.”*
**Din roll som Integration Specialist**
 Hos Oss Får Du Möjligheten Att Jobba Teamorienterat i Meningsfulla Och Kundnära Projekt. Som Integrationskonsult Hos Oss Har Du Möjlighet Att Utvecklas Inom Följande Ansvarsområden
   

  

**Integration & API developer** 
 – Detta är en mer renodlad utvecklingsroll med fokus på att bygga och testa diverse molnbaserade integrations- och plattformslösningar. Du använder problemlösning och förståelse för affärsprocesser för att definiera optimala lösningar för kunder, samt ansvarar för implementeringen av lösningar enligt projektkraven. Tidigare erfarenhet av systemutveckling och förmåga att utveckla och implementera diverse integrationslösningar hjälper dig att ta dig an denna roll.
   

  

**Integration lead** 
 – I denna roll har du chansen att jobba närmare verksamheten där du i dialog med kundens verksamhet och andra system tar fram krav på integrationer, leder integrationsarbetet och tester av integrationer. Här ser vi gärna att du är familjär med integrationskoncept och har tidigare erfarenhet i en teknisk och kundnära roll där du jobbat med kravhantering samt teknisk design av integrationer.
   

  

**Integration architect** 
 – I denna roll fungerar du som stöd till kunden exempelvis beträffande integrationsstrategier, analys av befintliga system, och val av tekniker. Du designar och definierar den övergripande integrationsstrategin och arkitekturen, och tar hänsyn till långsiktiga mål och effekter av integrationsinitiativ. Du hjälper även till att sätta principer för integrationer. Du leder ofta ett team av integrationsspecialister och är involverad i implementeringen av lösningar. Här vore det bra om du har djupgående kunskap inom integrationsdomänen, teknisk uppsättning av plattformar och integrationsmönster – helst med fokus på molnbaserad integration.
   

  

 Vi jobbar främst med molnbaserade plattformar eller ramverk i molntekniker som Azure, GCP och AWS. Det är därmed meriterande om du har kunskap i DevOps, IaC, infrastruktur och nätverk. Några av de tekniker som ofta används i våra projekt inkluderar bl.a. Boomi, Workato, Azure Logic Apps, Azure API Management, Software AG (webMethods).
   

  

**Karriärbanor på Solita**
 Jobbet som konsult hos oss innebär ofta en brant utvecklingskurva och variation sett till både arbetsuppgifter och roller. Vi ser karriärbanor inte som en specifik trappa utan mer som ett landskap med flera möjliga individanpassade orienteringar, både i höjd- och sidled, inom ett flertal kompetensområden.
   

  

 Sam jobbar exempelvis idag som People Lead parallellt med sin roll som Service Delivery Manager.
   

  

 Lia har haft chansen att bära många hattar under sin tid hos oss – från developer till lead developer och arkitekt i både lokala och gränsöverskridande integrationsprojekt.
   

  

 Andrei har också utvecklats väldigt brett som scrum master, team/tech lead, SDM, arkitekt, projektledare och kravställare i ett större projekt de senaste 3 åren.
   

  

**Vad vi erbjuder**
 Vår företagskultur är väldigt viktig för oss. Vi värdesätter låg hierarki, självständighet och ansvar, värdeskapande arbete och trevliga kollegor. Här kan du läsa mer om vår kultur, och här kan du bläddra bland våra tech-bloggar.
   

  

* Meningsfulla projekt: Arbeta i en agil miljö med varierande uppdrag där du kan påverka teknikval och arbetssätt för att skapa de bästa lösningarna
* Flexibilitet och autonomi för att utforma ditt arbete med flextider– läs mer från vår blogg.
* Ständig utveckling: Vi erbjuder kontinuerlig kompetensutveckling för att säkerställa att våra medarbetare ligger längst fram i teknikutvecklingen.
* Innovativ kultur: Arbeta tillsammans med några av de främsta experterna inom systemintegration, cloud och utveckling


 Utöver detta får du även ta del av följande
 **förmåner** 
 :
   

  

 💰 Fast lön oberoende av beläggningsgrad
   

  

 🏦 Pensionsavsättning i linje med ITP1 samt möjlighet till löneväxling till ditt pensionssparande vid inkomst över 8,07 inkomstbasbelopp
   

  

 🛋️ Möjligheter till flex för en god work-life-balance
   

  

 🏖️ 30 semesterdagar
   

  

 🩺 Sjukvårdsförsäkring via Skandia för både din mentala och fysiska hälsa som täcker dig även utanför tjänstetid
   

  

 🏋️‍♀️ Friskvårdsbidrag på 5000 kr via Benifex (tidigare Benify).
   

  

 💻 Ett brett nätverk av erfarna specialister från olika områden inom tech att samarbeta med
   

  

 🔗 Intern coach för att stödja ditt välbefinnande
   

  

 🪩 After Work och hobbyaktiviteter
   

  

 🥐 Fredagsfrukost
   

  

 Vilka är vi?
   

  

 Solita är ett värderingsstyrt konsultbolag med över 2000 medarbetare i 9 länder, varav 230 i Sverige. Vår storlek gör oss tillräckligt stora för att vara en stabil och innovativ arbetsgivare, men samtidigt tillräckligt små för att värna om våra medarbetare och kunder. Med bred kompetens inom digital transformation erbjuder vi en dynamisk arbetsmiljö. Hos oss får du friheten att utvecklas, både professionellt och personligt.
   

  

**Intresserad av att höra mer?**
 Låter det som en spännande utmaning? Skicka in din ansökan och bli en del av vårt team som ligger i framkant inom systemintegration. Om du har några frågor, hör gärna av dig till Head of People & Culture Patrik Rafstedt (patrik.rafstedt(at)solita.se); People Lead Sam Odeh (sam.odeh(at)solita.se) eller rekryteringsansvarig Kajsa Törnroos (kajsa.tornroos(at)solita.se).
   

  

**Hur ser processen ut?**
 I rekryteringsprocessen tror vi på en gedigen och effektiv process. Vi går igenom ansökningar löpande. Om vi ser en potentiell matchning, bjuder vi in dig till ett första möte för att lära känna dig och berätta mer om vår kultur och våra värderingar på Solita. I andra intervjun fokuserar vi på din tekniska kompetens och din erfarenhet. Om allt går bra tar vi oss vidare till sista steget där vi presenterar ett erbjudande och välkomnar dig som ny Solitan!
   

  

**Din arbetsplats kan vara belägen i Stockholm, Göteborg eller Malmö.**

title: TV Scheduler, Sports
description:
At Viaplay Group, we entertain millions of people every day through our streaming services, radio networks, and TV channels. We believe in the power of content not just as a way of telling stories and touching lives, but also expanding worlds.
   

  

 We’re looking for the best people to join us on our journey. Right now, we’re searching for a
 **Sports Scheduler** 
 in our
 **Stockholm office** 
 – are you ready to hit play on an exciting career change?
   

  

 The role
   

  

 Create playlists for premium linear sports channels as well as plan and schedule promos, fillers sponsorships etc. Communication with different stakeholders is key. You will join a high-performance team that works with tight deadlines and fast paced changes in a dynamic and fun world of sports.
   

  

* Develop the overall commercial strategy for premium linear sport channels and Viaplay.
* Create and maintain the program plan on which the daily and weekly schedule is based.
* Responsible for the broadcasts of commercials and packaging being correct.
* Close collaboration with colleagues in all departments, producers, sales and transmission in order to be up to date with all the changes live sports implies.
* Make sure all playlists are created correctly and on time for live playouts and re-runs.
* Constantly be on top of tasks and workflows towards other functions.


 What we’re looking for
   

  

 We understand you may feel confident ticking certain boxes more than others and that’s why we always keep an open mind in our recruitment process. But, in order to thrive in this role, we do believe you’ll have at least some experience in the following:
   

  

* Excellent Swedish and English skills, both written and spoken
* Problem solver
* Organized and structured
* Exceptional attention to detail and accuracy
* Used to working towards short deadlines
* Experience working in Microsoft Excel


**It’s a bonus if you have:** 
  

  

* Some experience from the broadcast business or/and linear tv
* Genuine interest to sports
* A can-do attitude, sense of humor and the ability to work humbly with others.


 What we offer you
   

  

**We’ve got you covered!** 
 30 days of paid vacation every year, an attractive pension and insurance scheme, and generous parental leave pay lift.
   

  

**Your wellbeing matters.** 
 We provide you with various wellbeing initiatives including wellness allowance.
   

  

**A safe space to grow and up-skill.** 
 Our learning culture puts you in the driver’s seat of your own development.
   

  

**Entertainment is what we love, and entertainment is what we do** 
 . So, unlimited access to Viaplay seems only fair for you to get to know the product – including series & viewing events, new release movie rentals, linear channels and more.
   

  

 Hit play today
   

  

 If this feels like your kind of challenge, make sure you apply by attaching your CV here – you may also want to add your LinkedIn profile. Please don’t send us your application via email because we won’t be able to accept it. We do, however, welcome any questions you may have about this particular position.
   

  

 Want to learn more about who we are and what we do? Check out our careers page or follow us on Instagram! We’re only ever a few clicks away.

title: Tax Accounting Specialist - Senior Manager - Tax Transformation Team
description:
*Join a dynamic, technology and process driven team supporting clients as they navigate the evolving landscape of finance, compliance, and tax. We help clients optimize their processes, stay compliant, and achieve strategic goals. Our clients are some of the largest multinational companies in the Nordics, and we help them stay globally compliant.*
 We are seeking an experienced Tax Accounting Specialist to join our Tax Transformation team. You will leverage the great work done by the rest of KPMG, supporting clients in implementing innovative tax solutions, navigating complex regulations, identifying critical data needs, and resolving data gaps. You will be instrumental in expanding our practice, generating leads, and demonstrating the value of our services to both colleagues and clients.
   

  

 Your responsibilities will include:
   

  

* Lead and support clients through the implementation of tax transformation processes, ensuring compliance and addressing complex tax challenges e.g. OECD Pillar 2, Public CbCR, Tax Administration 3.0.
* Collaborate closely with clients’ finance and tax departments, as well as KPMG specialists globally, to understand regulations, defined data needs, address data gaps and implement analytics and automation solutions.
* Understand and analyse organizations' financial and tax compliance processes, making complex laws actionable for clients and providing innovative solutions.
* Build and maintain robust client relationships, acting as a trusted advisor and delivering tailored tax transformation strategies.
* Drive business development initiatives by identifying, leveraging existing client relationships and pursuing new opportunities and communicate the value of our tax transformation services effectively to colleagues and clients.
* Stay informed on the latest tax regulations and industry trends to provide innovative solutions that clients are eager to implement, enhancing the client experience and contributing to the growth and expansion of our tax transformation team.


 ,
   

  

 We are looking for candidates with the following qualifications:
   

  

* A Bachelor's or Master's degree in Accounting, Finance, Taxation, or a similar discipline is required. Holding a professional certification such as CPA, CA, or an equivalent is highly preferred.
* Over 6 years of hands-on experience as an accountant, consultant, or related role in a large consulting firm (like the Big Four) or within large multinational corporations. In-house corporate tax or finance department experience is preferred.
* Extensive accounting experience with a preference for knowledge of tax regulations.
* Extensive understanding of financial and tax compliance processes.
* Extensive understanding of accounting and consolidated reporting standards used by major Swedish corporations.
* Experience in managing projects with various stakeholders.
* Analytical skills and a good understanding of finance, accounting systems, and financial data.
* Desire to drive digital transformation within finance and tax.
* Curiosity and willingness to question existing processes.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with proficiency in both Swedish and English.
* Demonstrated ability to build and maintain strong client relationships.
* Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment and contribute to a positive workplace culture.


 While we don’t expect you to meet every single requirement, we value a proactive, self-motivated approach, an eagerness to learn, and the ability to collaborate with colleagues across teams. We encourage our team members to actively contribute to the growth of junior team members.
   

  

**What We Offer**
 With multiple offices across the Nordics, we offer flexible working options, including remote work, flexible hours, and part-time arrangements. If you require flexibility, please feel free to discuss it with our team. Our core hubs for tax professionals are Stockholm, Aarhus, Copenhagen, Oslo, Helsinki. The location for this position is in Stockholm, depending on the candidate, other cities in Sweden where KPMG has offices may be considered. Our culture is built on trust, collaboration, and continuous development. We believe that when we work together, we create the best solutions to help businesses thrive.
   

  

* Be part of a leading global professional services firm with a strong commitment to innovation and excellence.
* Work with a diverse and talented team of professionals dedicated to delivering high-quality solutions to clients.
* Enjoy opportunities for continuous learning, professional growth, and career advancement.
* Benefit from a supportive and inclusive work environment that values work-life balance and employee well-being.


**Want to make a different with us?**
 If you are ready to take the next step in your career and contribute to transformative tax and compliance initiatives, we’d love to hear from you. Don’t wait with your application as we review applications and are hiring on a rolling basis. For more information or questions regarding the position, feel free to reach out to Sofie Pemer, Recruiter, at sofie.pemer@kpmg.se

title: System Administrator and IT Support in Gaming
description:
\*\*YOU MUST BE A CITIZEN OF THE EU OR EEA OR HAVE VALID WORK PERMIT TO WORK IN SWEDEN. 
 



  
 



  





**Job description** 
  
 



 Do you have a passion for gaming and IT operations? As a part of my3Twelve team, you will have an opportunity to be a System Administrator while helping with IT support for our clients to deliver experiences that meet the needs of customers. My3Twelve is seeking a proactive and skilled System Administrator with 2-3 years of experience in a corporate setting and who has a passion for gaming. The ideal candidate will be responsible for maintaining our IT infrastructure, ensuring system performance, and providing technical support to staff. 
 



  
 



**Key Responsibilities** 
  
 


* Monitor and maintain servers, networks, and computer systems
* Install, configure, and troubleshoot hardware and software
* Perform regular backups and disaster recovery operations
* Ensure security and privacy of networks and computer systems
* Implement and maintain system updates and patches
* Coordinating with multiple clients, balancing various tasks, and navigating competing expectations
* Collaborate with other IT team members to resolve issues and improve system performance
* Be front line for technical improvements, including desktop support and troubleshooting hardware and software issues
* Perform the IT-related tasks for the on and off-boarding process (PC build-out, dev kit setup, etc.)
* Develop and own a process for managing requests including how issues are tracked, status is communicated, and resolved
* Identify, advocate for, and implement changes for the IT helpdesk process workflows based on requirements
* Work on both tactical (day-to-day) and strategic (long-term) projects
* Learn and implement best practices from other IT pros across organizations
* Lead the effort to evaluate and recommend hardware for various disciplines
* Document IT procedures and system configurations



  
 



**Qualifications** 
  
 


* 2-3 years of experience as a System Administrator or similar role. Service-minded, positive, can-do attitude
* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field
* Strong knowledge of operating systems (Windows, Linux)
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team
* Experience with network administration and network security
* Experience with configuring Azure virtual machines
* Experience with ITIL process-based helpdesk system
* Experience with a ticketing system such as JIRA Service Desk, Autotask, Kaseya, or comparable helpdesk systems
* Experience with corporate environments: AAD, AD, Directory Services, ADO, SharePoint, etc.
* Extensive knowledge of client hardware for setup, optimization, and troubleshooting
* Knowledge of authentication issues and resolutions
* Knowledge about basic network issues and resolutions
* Knowledge of printing and common issues



  
 



**Highly Recommended** 
  
 


* IT Operations/Engineering experience with a Game Studio
* Experience writing code/scripts in C# or PowerShell
* Experience troubleshooting client related issues in a corporate environment and the restrictions that comes with said environment
* Certifications such as CompTIA Network+, CompTIA Security+, or Microsoft Certified: Azure Administrator Associate are a plus.



  
 



 Pay: 25 000,00kr - 50 000,00kr per month

title: Systemadministratör inom Windows
description:
Nu söker vi på Centric efter flera systemadministratörer inom Windows till flera av våra kunder i Stockholmområdet. Vill du bidra med din expertis inom Windows-servrar och klienter, din förmåga att dokumentera och göra systemkonfigurationer hos våra kunder? Då är det dig vi söker!
 



  





 Som konsult på Centric får du en trygg anställning och samlar på dig värdefull arbetslivserfarenhet på uppdrag hos våra kunder. Din konsultchef stöttar dig i din utveckling där du hela tiden fyller på med nya erfarenheter och kunskaper. En utmärkt möjlighet att göra karriär.
 



  





**Dina arbetsuppgifter** 




 I rollen som systemadministratör kommer arbetsuppgifterna variera beroende på vilken av våra spännande kunder du kommer arbeta hos. Sammantaget kommer du arbeta med det du gör bäst, administrera, hantera och underhålla Windows och Office365-miljön. Du kommer också arbeta för att säkerhetställa en stabil och säker infrastruktur efter verksamhetens behov.
 



  





**I Rollen Kommer Du Arbeta Med Följande** 



* Administrera och underhålla Windows-servrar och klienter
* Hantera användarkonton, grupper och behörigheter i Active Directory
* Underhålla och optimera O365-miljön
* Övervaka systemprestanda
* Felsöka och supportera användare vid behov
* Dokumentera och genomföra systemkonfigurationer



  





**Din profil och kvalifikationer** 




 För att lyckas i rollen är du en erfaren och motiverad person som på ett ansvarsfullt vis gärna tar ägandeskap över dina arbetsuppgifter. Vi ser gärna att du trivs i att arbeta i dynamiska team där du bidrar med flexiblitet och goda kommunikativa egenskaper.För att lyckas i rollen är du en erfaren och motiverad person som på ett ansvarsfullt vis gärna tar ägandeskap över dina arbetsuppgifter. Vi ser gärna att du trivs i att arbeta i dynamiska team där du bidrar med flexiblitet och goda kommunikativa egenskaper.
 



  





 För att lyckas i rollen är du en erfaren och motiverad person som på ett ansvarsfullt vis gärna tar ägandeskap över dina arbetsuppgifter. Vi ser gärna att du trivs i att arbeta i dynamiska team där du bidrar med flexiblitet och goda kommunikativa egenskaper.
 



  





 Krav
 


* Minst 3 års erfarenhet som systemadministratör i Windowsmiljö
* Mycket goda kunskaper kring Windows server, Active Directory och GPO
* Erfarenhet av Office365, inklusive Exchange och Sharepoint
* God förståelse för nätverkskonfiguration och felsökning
* Erfarenhet av säkerhetslösningar, så som brandväggar och backup-system
* Talar och skriver obehindrat på både svenska och engelska



  





*Meriterande* 



* Certifieringar inom området
* Tidigare arbetat i IT-projekt rörande IT-processer



  





 Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper.
 



  





**Vad vi erbjuder** 




 På Centric får du de verktyg du behöver för att nå dina mål. Vi erbjuder alla våra konsulter kvalificerade utbildningar och certifieringar inom den senaste tekniken. Vi tycker nämligen att våra medarbetare hela tiden ska fortsätta att utvecklas. Därför erbjuder vi dig möjligheten att lägga upp en individuell utbildningsplan, där vi bekostar såväl studiematerial som själva certifieringarna. Under din utveckling kommer vi matcha din kompetens mot rätt uppdrag i takt med att du avancerar. Vi genomför regelbundet spännande aktiviteter där du som konsult får möjlighet att träffa och umgås med dina kollegor under roliga och avslappnande former.
 



  





*Mer om oss* 




 Centric är ett IT-företag med 380 anställda, med kontor i Stockholm, Göteborg, Malmö och Linköping. Vi specialiserar oss på uthyrning av generalister och förmedling av specialister samt erbjuder outsourcing och systemlösningar inom retail. Vi är medlem i Almega Kompetensföretagen och följer deras tecknade kollektivavtal med Unionen.

title: Nätverkstekniker - Solna
description:
**Nätverkstekniker till Prog-It i Solna**
 Har du arbetat några år i en NOC eller som "nätverkpersonen" i ett internt IT-team men inte haft nätverk som ditt huvudsakliga fokus?
   

  

 Vill du lämna det grafiska gränssnittet bakom dig och spendera dina dagar i CLI?
   

  

 Sök tjänsten som
 **nätverkstekniker** 
 hos
 **Prog-It** 
 !
   

  

**Prog-It** 
 söker nu vår nästa
 **nätverkstekniker** 
 till vårt kontor i
 **Solna** 
 . Vi tror att du har några års erfarenhet av att hantera och konfigurera brandväggar, trådlösa nätverk eller routing och switching i kontors- eller datacentermiljöer. Om du har erfarenhet av Cisco, Unifi eller Fortinet-produkter är det ett ännu bättre!
   

  

 Vi tror också att du kan ta dig an rollen som nätverksingenjör direkt och känna dig trygg i att driva dina arbetsuppgifter framåt på egen hand.
   

  

**Rollen erbjuder en kreativ och spännande IT-miljö** 
 där nya lösningar skapas tillsammans med engagerade och kompetenta kollegor. Du kommer att arbeta i moderna miljöer med höga krav på säkerhet, tillförlitlighet och flexibilitet.
   

  

**Arbetsuppgifter**
* Dagliga aktiviteter för nätverksdrift, förvaltning av nätverksenheter samt konfiguration och uppsättning av nätverksinfrastruktur enligt kundens önskemål
* Administration och konfiguration av säkerhetsåtgärder i routrar och brandväggar
* Automation och skriptning för att effektivisera arbetsflöden vid konfiguration och hantering av nätverksenheter
* Deltagande i kundmigrationsprojekt och etablering av nya kundmiljöer


**Din profil och kvalifikationer**
 Vi söker dig som känner dig trygg i att utföra arbetsuppgifter i medelstora till stora nätverksmiljöer. Vi värdesätter bred erfarenhet, exempelvis av att hantera hela campusnätverk inklusive routrar, switchar, accesspunktskontroller och brandväggar, snarare än att vara specialist på ett enskilt område.
   

  

 Du har troligtvis några års erfarenhet inom två eller fler av följande områden:
   

  

* Konfiguration och administration av Cisco-switchar och routrar samt HP-nätverksutrustning.
* Administration av trådlösa nätverk i Cisco Meraki- eller Ubiquiti Unifi-produkter.
* Konfiguration och administration av Fortinet- och Cisco-brandväggar, exempelvis VPN- eller MPLS-tunnlar, proxy-konfiguration, trafikfiltrering och åtkomstkontroll.
* Stark förståelse för TCP/IP-protokoll och felsökning av nätverk.


 Certifieringar motsvarande
 **Cisco CCNP** 
 eller
 **Fortinet FCP** 
 är starkt meriterande.
   

  

**Vi Tror Att Du**
* Är driven och ambitiös - du är självgående och tar egna initiativ!
* Är lösningsorienterad och har en god förståelse för helheten i en infrastruktur.
* Är kommunikativ och har god samarbetsförmåga.
* Har en stark vilja att samarbeta och arbeta i team.


 Det är ett krav att du kan kommunicera dagligen på svenska i tal och skrift som ditt huvudsakliga språk på grund av kundkrav.
   

  

**Vi Erbjuder**
* En trivsam arbetsmiljö och omväxlande arbetsuppgifter.
* En teknisk utvecklingsmiljö som främjar personlig drivkraft.
* Internationella team.
* Attraktiva förmåner och bonussystem.
* Friskvårdsbidrag.
* Tjänstepension.


 Välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Communication Specialist, IT Operations
description:
Do you love shaping complex ideas into clear, engaging messages? Are you excited about actively supporting teams and improving communication in a practical, hands-on way? We’re looking for a proactive Communications Specialist to bring clarity and connection to IT Operations.
   

  

**About The Team**
 Our Site Reliability & Process Operations team is dedicated to ensuring the stability, security, and resilience of our systems and services. We drive continuous improvement across technical and process areas, fostering reliable operations and strong communication practices. With expertise in Cyber Security, Change Management, Monitoring, Networking, and Operational Efficiency, our mission is to empower the organization by optimizing performance, enhancing security, and ensuring long-term stability.
   

  

**About The Role**
 In this role, you’ll be deeply involved in day-today communication activities – creating content, optimizing tools, and ensuring teams stay informed, engaged, and empowered. As the go-to expert for tools like MS Teams, Confluence, and the Intranet, you’ll help teams collaborate more effectively by making communication seamless and accessible. Whether you’re crafting engaging content, supporting Townhall meetings, or enhancing internal communication practices, you’ll ensure our messages resonate and drive engagement.
   

  

 This role isn’t about leading a communication strategy – it’s about actively making communication work through hands-on execution. If you’re excited about working directly with digital tools and practical communication solutions, let’s create something impactful together!
   

  

 We believe in fostering both professional growth and a healthy work-life balance. As a hands-on Communications Specialist, you will have the opportunity to make a direct impact by improving communication tools and practices across IT Operations. You will work closely with teams across the organization, building strong relationships and best practices. You will also have an opportunity expand your expertise through continuous learning and professional development and enjoy a flexible and supportive work environment with remote working options.
   

  

 Key Responsibilities:
   

  

* Create and manage engaging content for newsletters, MS Teams, Confluence, and the Intranet.
* Organize and promote structured, interactive, and impactful Townhall meetings.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to boost internal awareness and strengthen communication practices.
* Train and support teams in effectively using communication tools to enhance collaboration.
* Coordinate cross-unit forums, like the Community Builder, bringing together representatives from all locations.
* Ensure communication remains visible, accessible, and effective across IT Operations.


 Who are You?
   

  

 You’re a proactive and hands-on communicator who enjoys working directly with communication tools, supporting teams, and improving internal processes. You have excellent written and verbal communication skills and thrive on making collaboration smoother and more effective.
   

  

 You also have:
   

  

* Experience in hands-on communication role, focusing on execution rather than strategy.
* Strong skills in optimizing tools like MS Teams, Confluence, and the Intranet.
* A passion for helping teams improve their communication practices through practical solutions.
* Fluency in Swedish and English, both written and oral.


 Additional information and recruitment process
   

  

 Applying: Please apply through our recruitment system by attaching your CV and answering the questions on the application form. Please notice that we are not able to handle any applications outside our recruitment system (Workday).
   

  

 Application deadline: Last day to apply is 23rd of March 2025. We will start screening and interviewing already during the application period.
   

  

 Location: Stockholm, Sweden
   

  

 Employment type: Permanent and full-time
   

  

 Traveling: Travelling in the Nordic and Baltic countries is required.
   

  

 Background check: Final candidates will undergo a background check before a job offer can be presented. Background checks will be done in accordance with the law in the country of employment.
   

  

 If you're a proactive, hands-on communicator who enjoys optimizing tools and supporting teams, we want to hear from you! Apply now and help us create clear, effective, and engaging communication within IT Operations!
   

  

 For more information regarding the position, please contact jessica.ostergren@if.se.
   

  

**About Us**
  

***We are If. Our purpose is to give people confidence today to shape their tomorrow.**
 To make this possible, trust is our backbone. We stay ahead and challenge ourselves to grow. And we always put our hearts into it – because it takes more than bright minds to make brilliant things happen.
   

  

 We are the leading insurance company in the Nordics/Baltics and a stable employer with 7,900 dedicated professionals. But most importantly, we are protectors of people, enablers of companies and encouragers of dreams. With our joint force of expertise and engagement we always stand by our customers’ side. Giving them the security and the confidence to be curious, explore new worlds, start new businesses and live their lives.
   

  

 We are an equal opportunity employer, convinced that a diverse and inclusive work culture boosts innovation and the growth of intellectual capital in many ways. It doesn’t matter who you are, where you come from, or what you look like. It is the different perspectives, backgrounds, and experiences each of us have and share, that will make a difference.
   

  

 Come and join us!*

title: Information Security Specialist
description:
Are you a Information Security Specialist looking for new challenges and a place to grow as a professional? Do you want to be part of influencing the well-being of employees with the help of technology for its users? If yes, you might be a great fit for our fast growing company. Read more below and apply to join Epassi!
   

  

**Epassi** 
 is looking for
 **Information Security Specialist** 
 to be based in either Helsinki, Finland or Stockholm, Sweden to join our Epassi family! In this role, you will be assisting us in ensuring the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of our company's information systems and our and customers’ data. You will work closely with our IT department, technical experts, internal stakeholders, and external partners.
   

  

**As An Information Security Specialist You Would Be**
 Your daily tasks as a Information security specialist will include daily administration tasks related to information security, such as:
   

  

* Security assessments of information systems and infrastructures
* Implementation and maintenance of security measures to ensure compliance and security of our data assets
* Development and implementation of information security policies and procedures
* Investigating information security breaches and preventing similar incidents
* Ensuring compliance with safety policies and regulations
* Participation in information security audits (internal and external)


**Why You Should Join Epassi**
* We are fast growing tech company; you will have a chance to impact on many meaningful things and grow together with us as a professional
* We have an inspiring & supportive culture and we take care of the wellbeing of our employees
* We provide a flexible hybrid work model and care about your work-life balance
* We take care of the professional development of Epassians by creating a personal development plan individually and supporting development by providing a yearly budget
* We have a unique team environment - international, motivated, supportive colleagues with a great sense of humor
* Epassi has a great benefit package such as private health care, lunch benefit, wellbeing & culture benefit, healthy snacks & refreshments at the office


**You Will Be a Great Fit If You Have**
* A suitable Bachelor’s or Master’s degree
* Experience of working in Security or IT
* Experience of the most known security frameworks and regulations (e.g., EU-GDPR, ISO27001 and NIST)
* Experience with security assessment tools and techniques
* Strong organisational and analytical skills
* Good communication skills in English (Finnish is seen as a plus)


 Hiring manager for this position is Head of IT, Pekka Pietikäinen. If you want to ask more information about this opportunity, please contact careers@epassi.com.

title: Director Analyst, End User Computing (Remote Europe)
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting, Information Services, and Research Services
description:
Gartner Analysts are industry thought leaders who create must-have research, market predictions and best practices for a broad range of world-leading organizations. A Director Analyst serves as a leader within Gartner’s Research and Advisory sector, establishing oneself as a credible voice within their designated market at local, regional, and global levels. Utilizing exceptional research and analytical skills, an analyst plays a significant role in producing pragmatic and provocative research which Gartner clients consume and apply to propel their business toward key objectives. They are a trusted source of advice for clients, reinforcing Gartner’s value every day by engaging them via in-person meetings, virtual meetings, sales support visits and Gartner conferences to discuss complex client challenges and offer appropriate recommendations.
   

  

 In your role as the
 *Director Analyst for Endpoint Management and Mobility* 
 , you will be primarily responsible for leading, and advising Gartner clients by researching the management and support of endpoint management, mobile strategy, and mobile/endpoint devices. You will be responsible for creating and delivering both strategic and tactical digital workplace and end user computing advice and research content, which guides enterprise IT leaders on critical technologies through written research reports, presentations, teleconferences, and client interactions.
   

  

**What you will do:**
* Conduct research and analysis in endpoint management technologies, endpoint management strategies, and mobile technologies.
* Write high quality, clear, actionable, advisory research documents.
* Provide clients and prospects with actionable advice aligned to their designated content area primarily via virtual interactions.
* Stay up to date on developments and issues within specified research topic areas and applicable adjacent topic areas.
* Create innovative, thought provoking, and highly leveraged “must-have research” content.
* Develop new research and ideas through thought leadership and offer compelling, actionable approaches to client's needs and requests that accelerate the client's ability to act.
* Develop in-depth analysis to identify the root cause of a client’s barriers or overall needs and reframe thinking to drive strategy forward.
* Research, analyze and predict market trends and shifts to provide clients with actionable insights.
* Create and deliver high value presentation materials for Gartner events and client briefings.
* Proactively work with the wider sales organization and deliver outstanding sales support to retain and grow the business.
* Provide high quality and timely research content peer review.
* Build credibility as an industry expert to represent Gartner research, methodology and strategy.
* Actively participate in innovation, ideation, and research discussions and collaborate effectively with peers in the research community.
* Identify research process improvements or develop new processes that help the team and Research & Advisory provide excellent service delivery.
* Be a mentor and a coach by supporting more junior team members.
* Be client-centric while actively seeking to help clients engage regularly and often with Gartner research and interactions.


**What you will need:**
 Examples of proactive learning and pursuit of knowledge beyond current areas of expertise.
   

  

* 10+ years experience in a leadership position in an IT organization, at a vendor, or consultant with one or more of the following disciplines:
+ Endpoint management concepts, example include patching, endpoint provisioning, etc
+ Implementing enterprise mobile strategies or supporting mobile technologies

* Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience and 10+ years of experience in a related field or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
* Be self-motivated to deliver timely and high-quality research collateral working under broad direction remote from your team.
* Willingness and the capability to constructively challenge client thinking and assumptions.
* Willingness and ability to travel up to 25% (where applicable).


**Who are we?**
 At Gartner, Inc. (NYSE:IT), we guide the leaders who shape the world.
   

  

 Our mission relies on expert analysis and bold ideas to deliver actionable, objective insight, helping enterprise leaders and their teams succeed with their mission-critical priorities.
   

  

 Since our founding in 1979, we’ve grown to more than 20,000 associates globally who support ~15,000 client enterprises in ~90 countries and territories. We do important, interesting and substantive work that matters. That’s why we hire associates with the intellectual curiosity, energy and drive to want to make a difference. The bar is unapologetically high. So is the impact you can have here.
   

  

**What makes Gartner a great place to work?**
 Our sustained success creates limitless opportunities for you to grow professionally and flourish personally. We have a vast, virtually untapped market potential ahead of us, providing you with an exciting trajectory long into the future. How far you go is driven by your passion and performance.
   

  

 We hire remarkable people who collaborate and win as a team. Together, our singular, unifying goal is to deliver results for our clients.
   

  

 Our teams are inclusive and composed of individuals from different geographies, cultures, religions, ethnicities, races, genders, sexual orientations, abilities and generations.
   

  

 We invest in great leaders who bring out the best in you and the company, enabling us to multiply our impact and results. This is why, year after year, we are recognized worldwide as a great place to work.
   

  

**What do we offer?**
 Gartner offers world-class benefits, highly competitive compensation and disproportionate rewards for top performers.
   

  

 In our hybrid work environment, we provide the flexibility and support for you to thrive — working virtually when it's productive to do so and getting together with colleagues in a vibrant community that is purposeful, engaging and inspiring.
   

  

 Ready to grow your career with Gartner? Join us.
   

  

 The policy of Gartner is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, citizenship status, age, national origin, ancestry, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected status and to seek to advance the principles of equal employment opportunity.
   

  

 Gartner is committed to being an Equal Opportunity Employer and offers opportunities to all job seekers, including job seekers with disabilities. If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access the Company’s career webpage as a result of your disability. You may request reasonable accommodations by calling Human Resources at +1 (203) 964-0096 or by sending an email to ApplicantAccommodations@gartner.com.
   

  

 Job Requisition ID:95569
   

  

 By submitting your information and application, you confirm that you have read and agree to the country or regional recruitment notice linked below applicable to your place of residence.
   

  

 Gartner Applicant Privacy Link: https://jobs.gartner.com/applicant-privacy-policy
   

  

**For efficient navigation through the application, please only use the back button within the application, not the back arrow within your browser.**

title: Linux Desktop Support Associate (London UK office)
description:
This is an opportunity to kickstart your career by joining Canonical. If you have a passion for technology and Linux, and an eagerness to learn, then you will enjoy working with some of the best people in the industry at Canonical.
   

  

 The role of a Linux Desktop Support Engineer at Canonical
   

  

 You will be working from our Canonical London Office and will be accountable for delivering technical support to our employees and customers, as well as facilitating AV support for office conferences and events. From problem qualification to full resolution, you will own and manage your cases. When needed, you will transfer your cases to your colleagues or involve senior engineers.
   

  

 Your day to day job is to provide technical expertise, be an excellent communicator and a service-oriented professional. You will be the main technical engineering asset for the office, acting as a focal resource for the office staff. Every day you will have to make judgement calls to prioritise customer issues and maximise your effectiveness to juggle between office, in-person support, and remote support case management. You will also need to set time aside to learn about our new products and technologies, as well as become familiar with the office technical stacks, and evolve as a professional. You will participate in various training sessions, team gatherings, and company events.
   

  

 What your day will look like
   

  

 Your day to day duties will include:
   

  

* Work from our new, state of the art London, UK office and provide technical support for employees.
* Familiarize with and own the technical infrastructure supporting the office and the stack supporting events and customer demos.
* Provide technical onboarding support for new employees.
* Provide technical and infrastructure support during office events.
* Provide and maintain security monitoring for employees.
* Be available to take ownership of new cases via telephone, email, and web
* Ensure that each support request owned by you is handled as per our Service Level Agreement (SLA) and to the highest possible customer satisfaction by setting the right expectations and fulfilling your commitments
* Contribute your findings to a common knowledge base and keep it up to date
* Maintain regular communication and information exchange with the rest of the team, locally and remotely
* Identify and suggest any opportunities to provide a better service


 What we are looking for in you
   

  

* Bachelors or equivalent four year degree in a technical field from an accredited college or university. Preferable majors: Computer Science, MIS, Electrical Engineering, etc.
* Experience in a Linux based environment gained through university subjects or work experience
* Desktop Linux usage (desktop tools for editing files, browsing the Web, managing Internet connectivity, setup of printers/services/packages/external storage devices/etc. utilising command line tools for exploring and manipulating the file system)
* Basic troubleshooting (collecting logs, basic fine-tuning by editing configuration files)
* Familiarity with safely installing, uninstalling, reinstalling, and repartitioning machines with multiple operating systems and troubleshooting to recover broken installations
* Understanding of Gmail, Google Calendar, Google Applications, and Single Sign-On.
* Ability to learn quickly, thrive on change and handle the pressure of a customer facing job
* Excellent written and verbal English communication skills


**Additional Skills That You Might Also Bring**
* Some knowledge of programming (bash, Perl, Ruby, Javascript, C or C++, Go)
* Basic troubleshooting of Mac and Windows operating systems.
* Experience supporting virtualized environments (KVM, OpenStack, Virtual Box, VMWare)
* Experience with containers (LXD/LXC, Docker, Kubernetes)
* Experience with network troubleshooting
* Experience with AV event support, streaming and recording
* Customer support experience


 What we offer you
   

  

 Your base pay will depend on various factors including your geographical location, level of experience, knowledge and skills. In addition to the benefits below, certain roles are also eligible for additional benefits and rewards including annual bonuses and sales incentives based on revenue or utilisation. Our compensation philosophy is to ensure equity right across our global workforce.
   

  

 In addition to a competitive base pay, we provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. Please note that additional benefits may apply depending on the work location and, for more information on these, you can ask in the later stages of the recruitment process.
   

  

* Fully remote working environment - we've been working remotely since 2004!
* Personal learning and development budget of 2,000USD per annum
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Parental Leave
* Employee Assistance Programme
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues at 'sprints'
* Priority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.
   

  

 Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.
   

  

 Canonical is an equal opportunity employer
   

  

 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.
   

  

 #Stack

title: Hybrid Infrastructure Engineer
description:
We are in Business for People, empowering people in service organizations with innovative Enterprise and Business software solutions. We’ve innovated and taken a new approach to delivering ERP that works for people. Self-driving, adaptive and intuitive software that is changing the way people work. Our solutions empower people and deliver a better people experience so people can spend time on meaningful high value work they live for.
   

  





 Read more on our website about how we transform work and how people feel about it, so our customers and their people can thrive.
   

  

  

  




**Job Description**

 The Global Cloud Infrastructure Team is seeking a skilled Hybrid Cloud Operations Engineer to join our international team. As part of this dynamic team, you will play a key role in supporting our commercial offerings. Unit4 operates a sophisticated infrastructure spanning Microsoft Azure and on-premises data centers in Sweden. In this role, you will primarily work with Windows Server Virtual Machines deployed on VMware while also assisting in the setup of virtual networks and Azure native solutions.
   

  

  

  




**Qualifications**

**Required:**



* 3+ years of relevant experience
* General knowledge of Windows Server architecture and Active Directory
* Experience with VMware and virtualization technologies
* Hands-on experience with physical data centers, including cabling, moving components, etc.
* Flexibility to work outside of office hours and participate in weekend on-call support.
* Strong prioritization skills, both independently and as part of a team
* Proficient troubleshooting skills, with the ability to resolve complex issues
* Passion for learning new technologies and exploring innovative ideas
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills for engaging with internal and external customers



**Nice to Have:**



* Familiarity with Microsoft Azure & Microsoft certifications
* Experience with Dell Servers, Cisco Network devices
* Experience automating Windows systems using PowerShell or similar methods
* Knowledge of networking (VPN setup), file transfer servers, Microsoft SQL, and PKI infrastructure
* Experience with AWS


**Additional Information**

 Join Unit4 and be part of one of the most exciting journeys in the cloud ERP software space. We’re a fast-paced, high-growth, people-centric company, delivering enterprise software for a great people experience, and offering our own people a host of benefits and development opportunities. Grow with us At Unit4, we offer:
   

 • a culture built on trust - giving you the freedom and autonomy to be successful;
   

 • balance - with our uncapped time off policy, remote working opportunities and Global Wellbeing Days when the whole company can switch off and prioritize well-being;
   

 • talented colleagues, role models and mentors - work, learn and be inspired by some of the best talent in the software industry;
   

 • a commitment to sustainability - with initiatives such as our Act4Good program, a way for everyone at Unit4 to come together and engage in actions that benefit society and the planet;
   

 • a safe and inclusive working environment – supported by our Employee Resource Groups, which are open to all and include Women at Unit4, Pride at Unit4, Mental Health and Access at Unit4, and People of Color at Unit4.
   

  

**This role may require security clearance required for customer projects and access to sensitive (customer) data. That means that after you have accepted our offer, we could ask for background checks. Subject to applicable local laws, such security checks may require disclosure of personal information including criminal record declaration, right to work, personal identification and work history. No worries though – we'll handle it according to local privacy laws and keep your info safe. Questions? Feel free to reach out!**

title: Talented Industrial Designers – Arfve Accelerator 2025
description:
**Join Arfve Accelerator – Redefine Tech with AI & Modularity** 




 At Arfve, we challenge conventions. We’re building intelligent, modular technology designed to evolve—not expire. Our AI-driven, sustainable approach rethinks product design for longevity, adaptability, and circularity.
 



 We’re looking for 
 **talented industrial designers** 
  to push the boundaries of smart, modular innovation within our accelerator. Here, you’ll design products that don’t just function—they 
 **learn, grow, and last.** 




  





 This is an opportunity to invest in your future!
 **This internship is unpaid** 
 , making it ideal for final-year students or early-career professionals looking to gain hands-on experience and build a strong foundation for a future design position at Arfve. As we expand our product range with three additional sustainable, modular innovations, your vision and design expertise will be instrumental in bringing them to life.
 



  





 What You’ll Do
 



 🔹 Design innovative, modular, and sustainable product solutions.
 



 🔹 Develop user-centric concepts that blend functionality, aesthetics, and sustainability.
 



 🔹 Collaborate with engineers and marketing teams to create market-ready products.
 



 🔹 Work with cutting-edge AI-driven design processes to optimize product usability and longevity.
 



 🔹 Contribute to the foundation of Arfve’s design philosophy, shaping the future of our product ecosystem.
 



  





 What You’ll Gain
 



 ✅ Hands-on experience in an impact-driven startup.
 



 ✅ A highly autonomous role with significant responsibility.
 



 ✅ The opportunity to build a standout portfolio with real-world projects.
 



 ✅ A potential future design position at Arfve.
 



  





 📩 Apply now! Send your application and CV/Portfolio to:
 **team@arfve.com** 




 📅 Start date: Flexible (Flexible hours, remote and digital)
 



  





 🚀 This is more than just an internship—it's a launchpad for your future. Together, we dare to dream big and work hard to create something unforgettable.

title: Business Development Representative (BDR) - Sweden
description:
**Our Company**
 Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen.
   

  

 We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!
   

  

**The opportunity**
 From the moment you wake up in the morning, until you go to bed at night, consider the media you consume, the adverts you see, the apps you use, the websites you browse, and almost all of the shopping you do online throughout the day. Chances are that every single one of those interactions or experiences was touched by an Adobe product.
   

  

 We have a phenomenal opportunity for a Business Development Representative (BDR) to join our Digital Experience teams in Stockholm, Sweden!
   

  

 What you’ll do
   

  

 As Business Development Representatives (BDR), you are responsible for helping your prospects re-imagine their customer experiences using Adobe solutions & in the process crafting new sales opportunities for your Account Executives (AEs).
   

  

 You will anticipate and adapt to customers’ constantly evolving expectations with Adobe Experience Cloud.
   

  

* Drive force for identifying and providing high-value opportunities into the Sales pipeline and the first line of relationship development with prospective high-value accounts.
* Deliver a “consultative” approach to selling; taking time to understand the prospect’s business, their goals, objectives, and challenges before recommending a solution.
* Consistently achieve quality pipeline & other metrics such as Inbound lead follow-up & outbound account engagement metrics.
* Handle territory creation plan for your key account executives & their accounts.
* Researching key accounts, identifying decision-makers, generating interest, and developing accounts to stimulate need.
* Prospect, educate, qualify, and develop Target Accounts and inbound leads to build sales-ready leads and opportunities.
* Quickly route prospects and current customers to appropriate colleagues to assist in solving problems and driving value. Nurtures & provides education on areas of interest for under-informed customers.
* Setup, attend & run 1st level qualification meetings with customers prior to passing it on to relevant Account Executive & Solution Consultants.
* Work collaboratively with Sales & Solution Consultant teams to further qualify and generate pipeline.
* Updating CRM, Outreach, and other tools to ensure logging of key history & ensuring a smooth hand-off to the Account Executive.
* Collaborate closely with the Marketing team to run and assist in performing lead generation campaigns and follow-up on leads.
* Run outbound campaigns to ensure a balanced pipeline built across territories.
* Providing closed-loop feedback to BDR organization to ensure continuous process optimization.


**What You'll Need To Succeed**
* 1+ years’ experience in Sales/Business Development in a SaaS context, ideally engaging with enterprise clients.
* Confirmed sales skills delivering inbound & outbound experiences and building positive relationships at multiple levels within an organization.
* Experience running all areas of the BDR process including account planning, pre-call preparation, opportunity qualification, and objection handling.
* Self-starter with high motivation, independence, resilience, and ability to collaborate with sales & marketing teams.
* Ability to quickly learn & understand sophisticated business problems & translate customers' needs into solution plays.
* Proficient with standard corporate efficiency tools (email, voicemail, MS Office) and experience with sales tools such as Microsoft Dynamics, SFDC, Outreach, ZoomInfo, Lusha, etc.
* Phenomenal teammate with ability to work well with multiple partners across sales, marketing & solution teams.
* Full fluency in both Swedish and English are a must. Additional Nordic languages are a plus.


 The BDR role opens up many doors within the broader Adobe ecosystem. There are opportunities to advance into sales, customer success, marketing, and many more.
   

  

 As our many awards will tell you, at Adobe you’ll be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized around the world. You’ll be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our outstanding Check-In approach where ongoing feedback flows freely. If you’re looking to make an impact, Adobe's the place for you. Discover what our employees are saying about their career experiences on the Adobe Life blog, Adobe Life and explore the extraordinary benefits we offer at Rewards.adobe.com.
   

  

 Adobe is an equal opportunity employer. We hire dedicated individuals, regardless of gender, race or colour, ethnicity or national origin, age, disability, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or veteran status. We know that when our employees feel appreciated and included, they can be more creative, innovative and successful. This is what it means to be Adobe For All.
   

  

 We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are dedicated to crafting exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new insights can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!
   

  

 Adobe is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and affirmative action employer. We do not discriminate based on gender, race or color, ethnicity or national origin, age, disability, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other applicable characteristics protected by law. Learn more.
   

  

 Adobe aims to make Adobe.com accessible to any and all users. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation to navigate our website or complete the application process, email accommodations@adobe.com or call (408) 536-3015.
   

  

 Adobe values a free and open marketplace for all employees and has policies in place to ensure that we do not enter into illegal agreements with other companies to not recruit or hire each other’s employees.

title: Client Manager triResolve
description:
****About The Role:****
**Position** 
 : Client Manager (triResolve)
   

  

**Level** 
 : Analyst
   

  

**Department** 
 : Client Relationship and Services, triResolve
   

  

**Reports to** 
 : Team Leader, Client Relationship and Services
   

  

****About The Role****
 As a Client Manager within the triResolve team, you’ll be at the forefront of client engagement for our OTC derivative portfolio reconciliation service for our global clients. Acting as the primary contact for clients, you’ll support service delivery, troubleshoot trade data issues, and provide training, working closely with our global product, development, and sales teams. This is an exciting opportunity to gain hands-on experience in the financial industry, focusing on customer care, product improvement, and client onboarding.
   

  

****Key Responsibilities****
***Client Onboarding & Support***
* Organise client demos and assist in the pre-sales process, guiding clients through onboarding, setup, and testing to ensure smooth integration.
* Provide daily support for assigned accounts, responding to client needs via email, phone, and in person.


***Trade Data Analysis & Issue Resolution***
* Review and analyze trade data for accurate portfolio reconciliation, identifying and resolving any discrepancies.
* Stay informed on current market regulations to deliver consistent, compliant service.


***Customer Care & Engagement***
* Build and maintain strong client relationships through regular check-ins, health checks, and onsite visits.
* Conduct training sessions to promote advanced service usage, collaborating with Sales and Customer Success teams to maximize client engagement and satisfaction.


***Productivity & Product Development Support***
* Identify and raise requests for new product features, collaborating with Product Management and Development teams on requirements and user testing, contributing to ongoing service enhancement.
* Actively contribute to workflow and service improvements that enhance the overall client experience.


****Ideal Skills & Experience****
* Excellent communication skills in English; fluency in German is a plus.
* Detail-oriented with an understanding of financial products, particularly OTC derivatives.
* Experience or familiarity with trade data, collateral management, or regulatory processes.
* Strong multitasking abilities in a fast-paced environment, with an interest in learning and using advanced spreadsheet functions.
* Tech-savvy with a foundational understanding of databases or an interest in technology is highly advantageous.


 This role is perfect for someone with a client-centric mindset and a knack for problem-solving, keen to grow in financial technology.
   

  

****About OSTTRA****
*Candidates should note that OSTTRA is an independent firm, jointly owned by S&P Global and CME Group. As part of the joint venture, S&P Global provides recruitment services to OSTTRA - however, successful candidates will be interviewed and directly employed by OSTTRA, joining our global team of more than 1,200 post trade experts.*
 OSTTRA was formed in 2021 through the combination of four businesses that have been at the heart of post trade evolution and innovation for the last 20+ years: MarkitServ, Traiana, TriOptima and Reset. OSTTRA is a joint venture, owned 50/50 by S&P Global and CME Group.
   

  

 With an outstanding track record of developing and supporting critical market infrastructure, our combined network connects thousands of market participants to streamline end to end workflows - from trade capture at the point of execution, through portfolio optimization, to clearing and settlement.
   

  

 Joining the OSTTRA team is a unique opportunity to help build a bold new business with an outstanding heritage in financial technology, playing a central role in supporting global financial markets.
   

  

 Learn more at www.osttra.com.
   

  

**What’s In It For** 
**You?**
****Benefits:****
 We take care of you, so you can take care of business. We care about our people. That’s why we provide everything you—and your career—need to thrive at S&P Global.
   

  

**Our Benefits Include:**
* Health & Wellness: Health care coverage designed for the mind and body.
* Flexible Downtime: Generous time off helps keep you energized for your time on.
* Continuous Learning: Access a wealth of resources to grow your career and learn valuable new skills.
* Invest in Your Future: Secure your financial future through competitive pay, retirement planning, a continuing education program with a company-matched student loan contribution, and financial wellness programs.
* Family Friendly Perks: It’s not just about you. S&P Global has perks for your partners and little ones, too, with some best-in class benefits for families.
* Beyond the Basics: From retail discounts to referral incentive awards—small perks can make a big difference.


 For more information on benefits by country visit: https://spgbenefits.com/benefit-summaries
   

  

**Equal Opportunity Employer**
 S&P Global is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race/ethnicity, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, marital status, military veteran status, unemployment status, or any other status protected by law. Only electronic job submissions will be considered for employment.
   

  

 If you need an accommodation during the application process due to a disability, please send an email to: EEO.Compliance@spglobal.com and your request will be forwarded to the appropriate person.
   

  

**US Candidates Only:** 
 The EEO is the Law Poster http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/eeopost.pdf describes discrimination protections under federal law. Pay Transparency Nondiscrimination Provision - https://www.dol.gov/sites/dolgov/files/ofccp/pdf/pay-transp\_%20English\_formattedESQA508c.pdf
