title: Data Scientist
description:
*Vill du vara med och forma framtidens AI-lösningar och driva innovation inom avancerad analys? Vi söker nu en Data Scientist som vill ta en central roll i att utveckla och implementera prediktiva modeller och algoritmer – från idé till produktion.*
**Om jobbet**
 Som en del av vårt dynamiska team kommer du att samarbeta med tvärfunktionella grupper för att förstå affärsbehov och skapa lösningar grundade i data och avancerad analys. Du får möjligheten att visualisera och kommunicera insikter på ett sätt som gör skillnad, samtidigt som du coachar och vägleder kollegor inom maskininlärning och AI. Vi befinner oss i en spännande fas där AI spelar en allt större roll i vår verksamhet, och vi behöver dig för att ta våra lösningar till nästa nivå!
   

  

 Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter:
   

  

* Utveckla och implementera prediktiva modeller och algoritmer – från idé till produktion
* Samarbeta med tvärfunktionella team för att förstå affärsbehov och skapa data-drivna lösningar
* Visualisera och kommunicera insikter och analysresultat på ett tydligt sätt för olika intressenter
* Vägleda och coacha kollegor Inom maskininlärning och AI samt förbättra utvecklingsprocesser
* Hålla dig uppdaterad med de senaste trenderna inom AI och aktivt tillämpa nya insikter


**Vem är du?**
 För att lyckas i den här rollen tror vi att du har en stark analytisk förmåga, är nyfiken och har ett brinnande intresse för AI, data och maskininlärning. Du trivs i en innovativ miljö där vi testar oss fram och bygger lösningar från grunden.
   

  

 För att bli framgångsrik i denna roll ser vi att du har:
   

  

* Erfarenhet av att sätta maskininlärningsmodeller i produktion samt av hela livscykeln; idé/experiment, produktionssättning, underhåll och monitorering
* Gedigen kunskap i Python och SQL
* Erfarenhet av försäkringsbranschen och förståelse för affären
* Erfarenhet av MLOps och ETL-processer
* En relevant utbildning inom Datateknik, Data Science, Matematik eller liknande


 Det är även meriterande om du har:
   

  

* Erfarenhet av MLFlow, Docker och molnbaserade lösningar (gärna Azure)
* Förmåga att leda projekt inom AI och Data Science
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med API:er och strömmande data


**Om oss**
 Välkommen till Sak på Länsförsäkringar AB, vi stolta över att vara i centrum av vår teknologiska utveckling. Vi levererar innovativa IT-lösningar som driver vår verksamhet framåt och säkerställer att vi alltid ligger steget före. Vårt team av dedikerade experter arbetar tillsammans för att skapa en IT-miljö som är både säker och skalbar, vilket möjliggör för våra affärsenheter att nå nya höjder. Vi är här för att göra skillnad, varje dag.
   

  

 Vi är ett innovativt team på 14 personer som brinner för samarbete, kunskapsdelning och ny teknik. Majoriteten är data scientists, men teamet växer med AI Engineers, arkitekter och DevOps- Engineers. Vi leder AI-utvecklingen inom Länsförsäkring AB och skapar lösningar som gör skillnad. Hos oss blir du en nyckelspelare i en spännande resa där vi formar framtidens AI – vill du vara med? Sök idag!
   

  

**Mer information**
*Låter det spännande? Då vill vi veta mer om dig! Välkommen med din ansökan redan idag. Vi arbetar löpande med denna rekrytering och kan komma att tillsätta tjänsten innan sista ansökningsdag.*
**Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-03-28**

title: CAM Specialist
description:
### **Job Applicant Privacy Notice**


**CAM Specialist**
==================

Publication Date: Mar 21, 2025
Ref. No: 529145
Location:
Linkoping, SE
Eviden, part of the Atos Group, with an annual revenue of circa € 5 billion is a global leader in data-driven, trusted and sustainable digital transformation. As a next generation digital business with worldwide leading positions in digital, cloud, data, advanced computing and security, it brings deep expertise for all industries in more than 47 countries. By uniting unique high-end technologies across the full digital continuum with 47,000 world-class talents, Eviden expands the possibilities of data and technology, now and for generations to come.

  


**CAM Specialist**

  


We are known for our unmatched expertise leading to long partnerships and high happiness of our clients – often described as a customer for life -attitude. We are proudly serving over 400 customers from large enterprises to fast-growing start-ups in the Nordic & Baltic countries.

  


Does that sound like the perfect career opportunity for you? If yes, do not hesitate to apply and become part of our team.

  


**Main Responsibilities:**

  


* Act as the subject matter expert for CAM (Computer Aided Manufacturing) solutions within the organization.
* Provide technical support and guidance to internal teams and clients regarding CAM tools and platforms.
* Design, configure, and implement CAM solutions tailored to meet client or organizational requirements.

  




**Required Capabilities:**
--------------------------

  


* Minimum 3 Years Previous CAM Programming Experience
* Knowledge of Siemens NX would be an advantage.
* Knowledge around Postprocessors would be an advantage.
* Proficiency in Swedish and English language
* Basic knowledge and usage of MS products

  




**What We Offer:**

  


* Flexibility and work-from-home policy
* International teamwork & collaboration
* Work closely with executive management.
* Have a positive impact on the organization.
* Possibility to work abroad with international clients.

  




We offer an opportunity to work with leading manufacturing companies from different industries. With us, you will part of a successful team crafting meaningful impact for industrial companies in their Industry 4.0-related and other manufacturing initiatives in Northern Europe. We offer a competitive salary, extended health insurance, and additional local and country-specific benefits depending on your place of work. Most of all, you will get excellent supportive colleagues who will be working with you for our shared success! We offer the culture and look-and-feel of a small company combined with the support and career opportunities of a global IT company!

  


We are an equal-opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, perform essential job functions, and receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request an accommodation.

  


#Eviden


#LI-SD3

  


**Let’s grow together.**

title: Erfaren förvaltningsledare
description:
*Vill du ta ditt konsultande till nästa nivå hos en av Sveriges bästa arbetsgivare? Vi vet vad du tänker. Du har hört det förut. Men tro oss, det har du inte. Vårt körsbär på konsulttårtan är något annat. Sök jobbet och smaka själv!*

**Rollen**

  

Vi söker nu en erfaren och självgående Förvaltningsledare IT för ett spännande uppdrag hos en offentlig aktör. Du kommer att arbeta i en PM3-styrd organisation och fungera som länken mellan verksamheten och IT-infrastruktur. I rollen driver du mindre IT-uppdrag, prioriterar och fördelar IT-ärenden, medverkar i budgetarbete samt genomför informationsklassificeringar och riskanalyser kopplade till verksamhetens leveranser.


I uppdraget kommer du främst arbeta med de IT-system som används av skolor. Leveransen består till stor del av tjänster via molnleverantörer.

### **Vi söker dig som:**

* Har hög kompetens inom området och minst 4 års erfarenhet av rollen som förvaltningsledare IT.
* Kan ta ansvar för ett delområde och leda en mindre grupp.
* Arbetar självständigt och är en förebild för andra.
* Är svensktalande och svensk medborgare.

### **Meriterande:**

* Erfarenhet av förvaltning och riskbedömning av molntjänster.
* Erfarenhet av konfiguration av Google Cloud och Google Classroom.
* Erfarenhet av konfiguration av IST Administration.
* Erfarenhet av integrationer via SS12000.
* Erfarenhet av förvaltning av skolsystem.

  

**Det bästa åt de bästa – vår personalfilosofi**

  

På Castra tror vi på att skapa en arbetsmiljö där varje individ får chansen att nå sin fulla potential. Hos oss får du friheten att själv styra över dina uppdrag, arbetstid och kompetensutveckling. Vi ger dig möjlighet att forma ditt arbetsliv efter dina behov och ambitioner. Som en del av vårt team har du också möjligheten att bli delägare, vilket ger dig verkligt inflytande över både din egen och företagets framtid.


Vi erbjuder en dynamisk arbetsmiljö där utveckling står i fokus. Med spännande uppdrag och tillgång till en snabbfotad säljstyrka stöttar vi dig i att hitta uppdrag som passar just dig.


Vi är stolta över att vara ett **Gasell- och Karriärföretag** som kombinerar stark tillväxt med en fantastisk arbetsmiljö. Sedan 2017 har vi varit certifierade av **Great Place To Work** och vi utsågs till **Sveriges Bästa Arbetsplats 2024**.

  

Castra Mellansverige har kontor i Jönköping, Örebro, Karlstad, Norrköping och Linköping. Castra finns även i regionerna Norr, Syd, Väst och Öst. Oavsett var du befinner dig finns vi nära till hands. För mer information, besök: https://www.castra.se/om-oss/

 **Har vi lyckats väcka din nyfikenhet?**


Sök direkt via länken eller kontakta oss:


sarah.ohlsson@castra.se


076-315 72 35

title: Frontend Platform Engineer
description:
*Nordnet redefined the financial world as the first digital bank in Europe. Now we are about to do it again and the aim is to create the next generation of bank, in the cloud. We know that this requires great people, great teams, and great technology. Do you want to join us and build the new Nordnet?*

 **In brief**  

At Nordnet we want to democratize savings and investments by giving our customers access to the best tools and information whether you are a professional investor or a small saver. With modern technologies and speed of delivery we are building the next generation investment platform.

 **This is part of the role**  

Nordnet is a company with tech as the primary focus. In our agile and autonomous teams, you will be working with engaged colleagues that love to share their knowledge. As a developer at Nordnet you will have the possibility to make an impact and create value to our customers with continuous releases several times a day.  

  

**This is you**  

To thrive in this role, we believe that you love to contribute to a state-of-the-art developer experience and to work on improving and modernizing our frontend technology stack. You can easily connect with people, have a solution-oriented mindset and are happy to help and support others.

**As a frontend platform engineer, you:**

  

* Find developer experience important and like to contribute to it
* Work with modern JavaScript (ES6+), CSS, HTML, TypeScript, NextJS, ReactJS, NodeJS, Jest/Vitest
* Have experience of or interested in learning GCP, Nginx, Docker, Kubernetes, ArgoCD, GitHub actions & Terraform
* Gets motivated when faced with complex technical problems
* Like to be part of setting the architecture for the future
* Love to automate things
* 

**Nordnetters**

  

* Are proud of the friendly and humble environment
* Believe that the best code is written together and therefore appreciate pair/mob programming
* Continuously improving to ensure quality, making the code better with every release
* Commit to our goals as a team, sharing the responsibility, success and failure

**What we offer**

  

* Experienced team which build own products and support other teams and products
* Your expertise and contribution will be appreciated from day one
* Plenty of opportunities to grow as an engineer
* Competitive salary and compensation
* Flexible work setup (from office or hybrid)


We offer you the opportunity to work in a Nordic environment with a strong focus on delivery, product development and technology. Our ambitions are high and you will embark on a fast and challenging journey together with a skillful team of sharp and committed colleagues. We are embracing the agile way of working. Culture is built and cared for, each day by everyone. We’re proud of ours. Having a flat organization where anyone can talk to anyone creates a warm and friendly atmosphere worth protecting. We believe in a culture where every effort counts and where everyone is being recognized. A culture embracing our core values – passion, simplicity and transparency on all levels, no matter who you are or what you do.We are over 900 employees in Stockholm, Oslo, Helsinki and Copenhagen. Visit us on: www.nordnetab.com  

  

**Questions & applications**  

Apply today – we will start interviewing immediately. Please note that we do only accept applications through our recruitment system, hence no email applications will be considered. We want to inform you that Nordnet conducts mandatory credit and background checks, as well as drug testing as a part of our recruitment process.  

We look forward to receiving your application!

title: CSR Internship
description:
Choosing Capgemini means choosing a company where you will be empowered to shape your career in the way you’d like, where you’ll be supported and inspired by a collaborative community of colleagues around the world, and where you’ll be able to reimagine what’s possible. Join us and help the world’s leading organizations unlock the value of technology and build a more sustainable, more inclusive world.
  

  

**Your role**

Are you passionate about making a positive impact on society? Do you want to be part of a dynamic team dedicated to Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) initiatives? Apply today and join us for a three-month internship and help us drive meaningful change!
  

  

We are looking for an enthusiastic and motivated individual to join our CSR team as an intern. You are likely a recent graduate or a student currently pursuing a degree in a relevant field such as Environmental Science, Social Work, Business Administration, or a related discipline.
  

  

You are committed to making a difference and are eager to contribute to our CSR projects. You have a proactive attitude, excellent communication skills, and a passion for sustainability and social responsibility. You enjoy working in a team and are always ready to tackle challenges with innovative solutions. As a CSR intern, you will support our team in various CSR initiatives and projects.  



  

*In this role you will play a key role in:*  



* Assisting in the planning and execution of CSR programs and events
* Helping to create and distribute communication materials related to CSR activities
* Collaborating with different departments to integrate CSR initiatives into our business operations
Monitoring and reporting on the progress and impact of CSR projects  
* 

  

**Your profile**

* Currently pursuing or recently completed a degree in a relevant field
* Strong interest in CSR, sustainability, and social impact
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Proficiency in Swedish both written and verbal is a plus  
* 

  

**What we believe you will enjoy about having your internship here**

As a CSR intern, you will have the chance to develop your skills and gain valuable experience in a supportive and collaborative environment. We offer:


* Mentorship and guidance from experienced CSR professionals
* Opportunities to participate in training and development programs
A chance to make a real impact and contribute to our CSR goals  
* 
**About Capgemini**  

Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market leading capabilities in AI, generative AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2024 global revenues of €22.1 billion.
  

  

**Get The Future You Want** | www.capgemini.com
company_description: Capgemini is a global leader in partnering with companies to transform and manage their business by harnessing the power of technology.

title: System Engineer
description:
**Qamcom is growing, and we are looking for talented Systems Engineers to join our office in Stockholm!**


Qamcom Research and Technology is an innovation hub specializing in intelligent, connected systems. We offer expert consulting services and product development in areas such as sensors, radars, signal and image processing, embedded hardware and software, multimodal AI analytics, wireless communication, edge-cloud infrastructure, and functional safety.


Our team possesses the comprehensive skills necessary to develop complete products for serial production. We can take ownership of every aspect of the development chain from the initial design to the final product.

**About the role:**


As a **Senior Systems Engineer**, you will work with experienced software and hardware engineers and algorithm specialists in our Stockholm office. You will be at the center of our projects, coordinating technical solutions across different domains and working closely with all team members. Our projects vary in size and scope, from small, fast-paced initiatives to large, multi-year developments. You should therefore be comfortable contributing hands-on to development work when needed. A background in software or hardware development is expected.

**Responsibilities include:**

* Own the system design process and facilitate cross-team collaboration to resolve technical challenges.
* Participate in all stages of development, including requirements definition, system design, prototyping, testing, and industrialization.
* Work closely with customers and partners to define product functionality, make implementation choices, and address lifecycle considerations.

**Who are you?**


You are a team player who thrives in dynamic environments and enjoys tackling new challenges. Curious and self-driven, you continuously seek to expand your expertise. You collaborate effectively across disciplines, sharing knowledge and communicating clearly. Your problem-solving mindset allows you to navigate complex technical landscapes, balancing trade-offs to achieve the best system design.


**Required Qualifications:**

* BSc in relevant field with 6+ years of experience in Systems Engineering, preferably in Qamcom’s fields of expertise.
* Background in software or hardware development.
* Strong understanding of system design principles, including engineering trade-offs and project goals.
* Experience in requirements and change management.
* Basic project management skills.
* Fluency in English.
* Swedish resident or valid Swedish work permit.

**Meriting:**

* Hands-on experience with relevant industry standards (e.g., functional safety or MedTech).
* Experience with sensor systems such as Radar, Lidar, Cameras (or other optical systems), or IoT devices.
* Experience with CI/CD processes.
* Knowledge of Machine Learning algorithms and frameworks.
* Working proficiency in Swedish.

**Qamcom offers**  

At Qamcom, we foster a collaborative and inclusive environment where experienced professionals and specialists work together on cutting-edge system solutions. Our in-house projects span hardware, software, and algorithms for industrial and MedTech applications, allowing us to apply advanced technology in real-world product development.


We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive team because we know that different perspectives drive innovation. So if you’re passionate about technology and bring relevant skills and experience, we want to hear from you. Your unique background and approach could be exactly what we need.

**Additionally, a sample of our benefits are listed below:**

* Flexible office hours and hybrid-remote working model.
* Possibility to bank extra hours worked and convert them to additional leave days.
* Competitive insurance and pension program.
* Generous parental leave (90% of the salary).
* Wellness benefits (5000 SEK/year).
* Bicycle leasing and employee car options (electric or hybrid).
* Fixed salary with annual salary reviews.


Join us at Qamcom, where your expertise will contribute to shaping the future of technology and innovation.

title: Global Account Manager, Sweden
company_industry: Computer Hardware Manufacturing and Software Development
description:
We’re in an unbelievably exciting area of tech and are fundamentally reshaping the data storage industry. Here, you lead with innovative thinking, grow along with us, and join the smartest team in the industry.
   

  

 This type of work—work that changes the world—is what the tech industry was founded on. So, if you're ready to seize the endless opportunities and leave your mark, come join us.
   

  

 Pure Storage is seeking a Global Account Manager (GAM) with proven ability to win and then lead a small subset of global Telco accounts. The GAM will coordinate the strategy and team-selling efforts with partners and teammates to close business on a quarterly and annual basis. Proven ability to exceed assigned quota, prospect, close global contracts, and build new and deep relationships with large global customers is key. The successful candidate will have demonstrated the ability to develop long-term relationships with Channel Partners that drive revenue as well as relationships with customers from end users to the line of business to the CxO. Ability to drive satisfied and referenceable customers while maintaining an accurate forecast and working with multiple channel partners is critical. This is a new business, hunter territory that requires experience and proven success opening large accounts.
   

  

**SHOULD YOU ACCEPT THIS CHALLENGE...**
* Prospecting: proven track record of penetrating accounts; reaching decision-makers and closing business.
* Direct strategic account planning and leadership of a global Telco account team
* Establish and manage complex relationship network of ‘C’ level stakeholders and highest level senior internal representatives
* Assemble and work to a detailed strategic account plan designed to deliver value and meet the customer's business and IT objectives
* Coordinate different areas of the organisation to formulate go-to-market strategies for nominated global accounts
* Manage complex customer/ supplier / partner dynamics
* Assess customer, market trends and provide timely and accurate revenue forecasting
* Drive accelerated revenue growth by identifying potential markets for new and existing products and services in accounts
* Identify, pursue and close sales opportunities and leads
* Deliver the necessary input to ensure on-time delivery of high quality proposals for managed accounts and prospects as well cost of ownership illustrations and business value justifications
* Develop sales, business and relationship plan for accounts


**What You’ll Need To Bring To This Role...**
* Deep understanding of the customer’s business, it’s market and industry alongside key decision-makers and influencers in account organization
* Ability to translate customer’s objectives and strategy into relevant Pure proposition
* Ability to effectively communicate at all levels of an organisation, including the C-suite
* Liaise with Global Enterprise Senior Management as required for executive level sponsorship program
* Experience of working with major Nordics Telco Global Accounts
* Experienced working with C Level (internal and customers)
* Strong decision-making skills – able to identify key business issues
* Strong communication skills – able to convey understanding and messaging in a clear, concise and compelling manner, both verbally and in writing.
* 7-10 yrs.+ successful global accounts/enterprise solution selling within technology services
* 7-10 yrs.+ Enterprise sales experience
* Ability to lead and manage an international and distributed team.
* Ability to think strategically and drive sales transformation programs
* Deep work experience in Telecommunications / IT Industry
* Enterprise Storage desirable
* Excellent communicator (Verbal, Written, Presentation)


**What You Can Expect From Us**
* Pure Innovation: We celebrate those who think critically, like a challenge and aspire to be trailblazers.
* Pure Growth: We give you the space and support to grow along with us and to contribute to something meaningful. We have been Named Fortune's Best Large Workplaces in the Bay Area™, Fortune's Best Workplaces for Millennials™ and certified as a Great Place to Work®!
* Pure Team: We build each other up and set aside ego for the greater good.


 And because we understand the value of bringing your full and best self to work, we offer a variety of perks to manage a healthy balance, including flexible time off, wellness resources and company-sponsored team events. Check out purebenefits.com for more information.
   

  

**Accommodations And Accessibility**
 Candidates with disabilities may request accommodations for all aspects of our hiring process. For more on this, contact us at TA-Ops@purestorage.com if you’re invited to an interview.
   

  

**Where Differences Fuel Innovation**
 We’re forging a future where everyone finds their rightful place and where every voice matters. Where uniqueness isn’t just accepted but embraced. That’s why we are committed to fostering the growth and development of every person, cultivating a sense of community through our Employee Resource Groups and advocating for inclusive leadership. At Pure Storage, diversity, equity, inclusion and sustainability are part of our DNA because we believe our people will shape the next chapter of our success story.
   

  

 Pure Storage is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We strongly encourage applications from Indigenous Peoples, racialized people, people with disabilities, people from gender and sexually diverse communities, and people with intersectional identities. We also encourage you to apply even if you feel you don’t match all of the role criteria. If you think you can do the job and feel you’re a good match, please apply.

title: (Senior) Cloud Security Engineer – based in Luxembourg
description:
**This position is based at our Luxembourg headquarters and requires regular office presence.** 
 The EIB offers you the opportunity to live and work in a truly international and multi-cultural environment. We also offer relocation support.
   

  

 The
 **EIB** 
 , the European Union's bank is seeking to recruit for its
 **Group Corporate Services Directorate – Group Digital Office (GCS-GDO) – Cybersecurity Division (CD) – IT** 
**‐Security Unit (SEC)** 
 at its headquarters in Luxembourg a
 **(Senior) Cloud Security Engineer\*** 
**.**
**This is a full-time position at grade 5/6 for which the EIB offers a permanent contract.**
* internal benchmark (Senior) Engineer IT Technology & Infrastructure.


*Panel interviews are foreseen as from February.*
 Purpose
   

  

 Are you passionate about staying ahead of ever-evolving cybersecurity landscape?
   

  

 Bring your career to the next level with us at the EIB, where innovation meets security in the cloud! Join our dynamic team and play a pivotal role in crafting cutting-edge security architectures for cloud and hybrid environments. With us, you'll collaborate closely with top-tier IT security professionals, enterprise architects, and cloud experts to ensure seamless integration of security controls, enhancing monitoring, resilience, and regulatory compliance across all IT systems.
   

  

 Operating Network
   

  

 We’re searching for an engineer with a drive who will accompany the EIB Group in its digital transformation journey.
   

  

 You will report to the Head of the IT Security Unit.
   

  

 Accountabilities
   

  

* Collaborate with IT security, architects, and cloud experts in developing secure cloud and hybrid environments, preparing cutting-edge security architectures
* Utilize cloud native tools like AWS Shield and Azure Firewall, becoming a cloud security expert by protecting our environments and guiding third-party security integrations
* Define and implement security standards in partnership with Cloud Operations and Cloud Center of Excellence teams, ensuring their effective application across our cloud environments
* Create detailed documentation and diagrams for security architectures and operational processes, developing comprehensive security documentation
* Provide cybersecurity solutions to support our engineering teams, enhancing the security of EIBG's IT environment
* Align with business needs and risk appetite while building strong business relationships and proposing applicable industry developments
* Integrate IT security controls into our Risk Management and Crisis Management processes, leading in information security governance
* Advise on cybersecurity management, guiding our cybersecurity strategy to align with organizational goals and risk tolerance
* Take the lead in monitoring and responding to security incidents in our cloud environments, ensuring swift detection and response
* Assist in organizing response and recovery during incidents as part of our incident response efforts, ensuring business continuity


**Qualifications**
* University degree (minimum an equivalent to a Bachelor), preferably in relation to risk management, IT or information management
* Minimum 5 years relevant experience with proven track record of success in IT security implementation, or IT security operations
* Experience in IT cloud security operations with public cloud provides preferably AWS or Azure
* Experience in running major security-related projects
* Knowledge of ISO/IEC27000 standard series
* Knowledge of security architecture, including cloud environments, endpoint protection, operating systems, strong authentication solutions, web security
* Experience in running major security-related projects
* Knowledge sharing skills, including presentations and conducting workshops, drafting of documentation
* Excellent knowledge of English and/or French (\*\*), with a good command of the other. Knowledge of other EU languages would be an advantage.


 Competencies
   

  

*Find out more about EIB core competencies* 
 here
   

  

 To find out more about our eligibility criteria click here
   

  

*(\*\*) Unless stated explicitly as a required qualification, a good command of French is not a pre-requisite for hire. As both English and French are however official working languages of the EIB, proficiency in both languages is a pre-requisite for your future career development. Any language clause in your contract must be fulfilled in order for you to be eligible for a promotion (either via the annual appraisal cycle or via an internal selection process). Proficiency is understood to mean the attainment of* 
*level 5 of the Inter Institutional language courses, corresponding to B1.2 of the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages (CEFRL). The Bank offers appropriate training support.*
 We hire and value talent with unique characteristics, creating a work environment where they can be themselves. We believe that Diversity, Equity and Inclusion makes us a performing and innovative organisation. We encourage all suitably qualified and eligible candidates to apply regardless of their gender identity/expression, age, racial, ethnic and cultural background, religion and beliefs, sexual orientation, disability or neurodiversity.
   

  

 We strongly invite applicants with a disability, neurodivergent profile or chronic condition to request reasonable accommodations at any stage during the recruitment process. Please contact the EIB Recruitment team Jobs@eib.org who will ensure that your request is handled.
   

  

 By applying for this position, you acknowledge the importance of maintaining the security and integrity of the Information of the EIB Group. In case of selection for the position you agree to comply with all measures (policies, controls, document classification and management) implemented by the EIB Group to prevent unauthorised disclosure of any information or any damage to the EIB Group reputation.
   

  

*This is an open campaign to consecutively fill open positions. The campaign will remain open until position is filled. Applications will be reviewed in order of receipt.*

title: Cloud Professional Services Manager
description:
This is an opportunity to run a Professional Services team (also known as Field Engineering) team, helping customers understand and implement Canonical's open source solutions in public clouds and in their own data centers. We work across the entire spectrum of cloud offerings, from Ubuntu itself to virtualisation and private cloud, Kubernetes, and the implementation of sophisticated open source solutions such as MLops platforms, data platforms and more. We are rapidly expanding the range of open source solutions we offer and deliver to customers, as we move into new industries like telco, finance, health care and media we design and develop new open source solutions to meet their needs.
   

  

 We believe that Engineering Managers should be outstanding engineers themselves. They should feel completely at home troubleshooting technical issues and having technical presales conversations with customers. They should contribute to project delivery themselves, but know that the technical contributions they bring are far less significant than their ability to shape the whole team's direction, focus and delivery. We grow management skills and train engineers, who are interested in soft skills, to be managers.
   

  

 We believe that open source is just starting to transform the tech sector and enterprise compute. Our goal is to make open source easier, more reliable and more secure for deployment and development. We strive to be the provider of 'most software to most companies'. To deliver on that ambition, our engineers are carefully selected from the applicants across the globe. We select for brilliance and motivation to take open source to the next level. Our engineering managers help teams achieve more than they realised they could, and feel proud of the result.
   

  

**The role of a Cloud Professional Services Manager at Canonical**
 The Field Engineering team is our team of cloud solutions architects at Canonical, working directly with our customers, designing private and public cloud solutions fitting their workload needs. The portfolio of products includes on-premise cloud solutions such as Openstack, MicroCloud and Ceph, and solutions that could be deployed either on-premises or in public clouds such as Kubernetes, Kubeflow, Spark, PostgreSQL, etc. The team works hands-on with the technologies by deploying, testing and handing over the solution to our support or managed services team at the end of a project. Managers and team members also take part in presales conversations to provide technical advice during the sales process.
   

  

 A Cloud Professional Services Manager is responsible for line management and career guidance. The ability to develop engineering talent, to represent your team from a technical perspective, and to drive collaboration with other teams and customers are all critical to success in this role. You are also expected to actively participate in technical presales to help our department achieve our quarterly goals.
   

  

**Location:** 
 This role will be home based, managing a team in your time zone.
   

  

**What your day will look like**
* Lead and develop a team of engineers, ranging from graduate to senior
* Work remotely in a single major time zone
* Coach, mentor, and offer career development feedback
* Identify and measure team health indicators
* Implement disciplined engineering processes
* Represent your team and product to stakeholders, partners, and customers
* Develop and evangelise great engineering and organisational practices
* Plan and manage progress on agreed goals and projects
* Be an active part of the leadership team, collaborating with other leaders


**What we are looking for in you**
* Knowledge of cloud computing concepts & technologies, such as Kubernetes, Openstack, AWS, GCP, Azure, Ceph, etc.
* Practical knowledge of Linux and networking
* Experience in technical presales
* You are a dynamic person who loves to jump in new projects and interact with people
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English
* Passion and a track record of developing and growing people
* Experience in leading, coaching and mentoring engineers
* Organised and able to ensure your team delivers timely, high quality results
* An exceptional academic track record from high school and, preferably, university as well
* Willingness to travel up to 40% of the time. Field Engineers attend internal company events, external tech events and customer meetings.


**Additional skills that you might also bring**
* Second language - Spanish or French preferred
* Python knowledge
* Experience collaborating with external partners
* Experience collaborating with several internal teams and providing stakeholder feedback for engineering roadmaps


**What we offer you**
 We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
   

  

* Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
* Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Maternity and paternity leave
* Employee Assistance Programme
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues from your team and others
* Priority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.
   

  

 Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.
   

  

**Canonical is an equal opportunity employer**
 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: Azure AIOps
description:
**Vill du tillhöra ett IT-konsultbolag där du får chansen att styra och påverka din vardag? Vill du hjälpa samhälle och näringsliv att nyttja kraften i ny och storskalig IT? Hos ICW får du ta plats och vara med och bestämma hur din arbetsdag skall se ut. Du får chansen att jobba självständigt på intressanta konsultuppdrag, där vi samtidigt är måna om att ha en stark teamkänsla. Vi stöttar varandra och månar om personlig utveckling, där vi utvecklas både som individer och bolag.**
 Vi Söker Efter En Person Som Förstår AIOps På Azure För Anställning Som IT-konsult Hos Oss Och Du Kommer Att Arbeta i Konsultuppdrag Ute Hos Vår Kund. Mycket Goda Kunskaper i Svenska, Både i Tal Och Skrift, Är Ett Krav. Som AIOps Har Du Arbetat Med Att Kombinera Övervakning, Automation Och AI-driven Analys För Att Minska Driftstörningar Och Optimera Prestanda. Du Har Arbetat Med Azure/Microsoft-verktyg Så Som
   

  

* Azure Monitor/Azure Log Analytics/Azure Application Insights/Microsoft Sentinel för övervakning och logghantering.
* Azure Automation/Azure Logic Apps/Azure Event Grid för incidenthantering och automation.
* Azure Machine Learning/Azure Copilot/Metrics Advisor/Azure Monitor AI-driven diagnostik för AI och analys.
* Microsoft Defender for Cloud/Azure Security Center/Azure DDoS Protection för säkerhet och efterlevnad.
* Azure Data Explorer/Azure Monitor for Containers/Azure Managed Grafana för observationer och datahantering.


**På ICW arbetar teknikspecialister, arkitekter och projektledare. Våra konsulter arbetar på heltidsuppdrag ute hos våra spännande kunder, såväl hos stora privata aktörer som inom offentlig sektor. På ICW kommer du till ett sammansvetsat team, där vi har roligt tillsammans.**
 ICW är strategisk IT-partner till flera av Sveriges större företag och organisationer. Tillsammans utforskar vi digitaliseringens möjligheter både inom innovation och effektivisering. Vi levererar hela projekt- och funktionsåtaganden och tar olika specialistroller hos våra uppdragsgivare.
   

  

 Vi är en platt organisation med korta beslutsvägar. Vi genomför varje år en uppsjö med aktiviteter och konferenser tillsammans. Vi erbjuder frihet i din anställning, med individuella förmåner baserat på en trygg och flexibel lönemodell. Work-life balance är en självklarhet för oss och du ges stor möjlighet att påverka dina uppdrag. Du får en årlig personlig utbildningsbudget och en överenskommen utbildningsplan för din vidareutveckling.
   

  

 Gillar du frihet, utveckling och lagkänsla? Då är ICW en arbetsplats för dig!
   

  

 Ansvarig för rekryteringen är Åke Siwertson, VD och grundare av ICW
 **- The future is what you make of IT**
